issues.title: So much things going wrong - multiple errors and unavailable devices / unresponsive UI
issues.body:
### What happened?

Suddenly my Zigbee2MQTT instance is starting to trow errors and certain devices do no longer turn online. I experience when I press the join button, nothing happens (but I do see in the logs the joining has started). Basically parts of the devices are not available, while the UI isn't working as expected too. 

`z2m: Failed to read state of 'Achtertuin Airco Plug Tuya' after reconnect (ZCL command 0x70ac08fffe529e7e/1 genOnOff.read(["onOff"], {"timeout":10000,"disableResponse":false,"disableRecovery":false,"disableDefaultResponse":true,"direction":0,"reservedBits":0,"writeUndiv":false}) failed (SRSP - UTIL - assocGetWithAddress after 6000ms))`

`z2m: Failed to ping 'Keuken Keukenspot Koffiemachine Hue' (attempt 1/1, ZCL command 0x00178801096c810c/11 genBasic.read(["zclVersion"], {"timeout":10000,"disableResponse":false,"disableRecovery":true,"disableDefaultResponse":true,"direction":0,"reservedBits":0,"writeUndiv":false}) failed (SRSP - AF - dataRequest after 6000ms))`

`z2m: Failed to read state of 'Achtertuin Navimow Plug' after reconnect (ZCL command 0xf0d1b8be240b4990/1 genOnOff.read(["onOff"], {"timeout":10000,"disableResponse":false,"disableRecovery":false,"disableDefaultResponse":true,"direction":0,"reservedBits":0,"writeUndiv":false}) failed (Timeout - 17494 - 1 - 98 - 6 - 1 after 10000ms))`

`z2m: Failed to read state of 'Slaapkamer Spot 2 Hue' after reconnect (ZCL command 0x0017880108cc9840/11 genOnOff.read(["onOff"], {"timeout":10000,"disableResponse":false,"disableRecovery":false,"disableDefaultResponse":true,"direction":0,"reservedBits":0,"writeUndiv":false}) failed (Data request failed with error: 'MAC channel access failure' (225)))
`
Some devices which are causing errors (they are always the same) I force remove them from the UI. One device I am unable to re-join and get interview challenges. 

`zh:controller: Interview failed for '0xa4c138b115eb3649 with error 'Error: Interview failed because can not get active endpoints ('0xa4c138b115eb3649')'`

Also I get a complete error when trying to start the joining process again

`z2m: Request 'zigbee2mqtt/bridge/request/permit_join' failed with error: '--> 'SREQ: ZDO - PERMIT_JOINING_REQUEST - 0ffcfffe01' failed with status '(0x11: BUFFER_FULL)''`

The buffer full seems to occurring when the instance is running for a longer time

I have two Sonoff ZBDongle-P - I have reflashed them with the latest coordinator firmwares. Using https://dongle.sonoff.tech/sonoff-dongle-flasher/ and the CC1352P2_CC2652P_launchpad_coordinator_20250321.hex. I have cloned the IEEE with the second Sonoff ZBDongle-P with ZigStar. I do assume I have ruled out an issue with the HW (in this case).

I tried 'latest', 'latest-dev', '2.6.1' and '2.6.0'. They all give the same issues as recorded above. I also removed and rebuild the docker images. 

### What did you expect to happen?

I am actually getting lost in the amount of errors and I can't find the 'root cause' issues. My expectations is that all devices are reporting back online and are responsive. 

### How to reproduce it (minimal and precise)

I have no clue what is going wrong. Hope somebody can help / provide guidance.

### Zigbee2MQTT version

latest-dev, latest, 2.6.1, 2.6.0

### Adapter firmware version

20240710

### Adapter

Sonoff Dongle P (ZStack3x0)

### Setup

I run Zigbee2MQTT in docker, on a synology DS720+. It worked for years, no significant updates performed in the last couple of days. Errors came out of nowhere

### Device `database.db` entry

_No response_

### Debug log

[log.log](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/22335345/log.log)

issues.title: Active Zigbee Devices appear as offline in HA after HA restart, even though online in Zigbee2MQTT
issues.body:
### What happened?

When restarting HA(version 2025.9.3) all active devices (lights and plugs) appear as offline/unavailable even though they are online and can be controlled via zigbee2mqtt. They can be made functional in HA again by chaning the name, then they appear online and can be controlled through HA.
Fixes I tried: changing the availibitly to false, will only make devices online until next HA restart.

Maybe this issue has to do with HA and not zigbee2mqtt?

### What did you expect to happen?

The active devices shouldn't appear as offline/unavailable.

### How to reproduce it (minimal and precise)

Devices are online, then restart HA, all passive devices will come back but active zigbee devices will stay unavailable

### Zigbee2MQTT version

2.6.1

### Adapter firmware version

20240710

### Adapter

UZG01

### Setup

Zigbee2MQTT are running in Podman containers. Also the issue occurs for all of our zigbee2mqtt instances (7 in Total)

### Debug log

_No response_

issues.title: Invalid action mapping for Osram Switch 4x EU-LIGHTIFY
issues.body:
### What happened?

Long press of the bottom right button generates an invalid action chain: move_to_saturation, hue_stop. And then hue_stop again after release.

### What did you expect to happen?

Should be similar to the long press of the top right button (move_to_saturation, hue_move, and then hue_stop after release).
Proposed Solution:
- file: zigbee-herdsman-converters/src/converters/fromZigbee.ts
- function: export const command_move_hue
- condition is: const movestop = msg.data.movemode === 1 ? "move" : "stop";
- condition could be: const movestop = msg.data.movemode === 1 ? "move" : (msg.data.movemode === 3 ? "reverse" : "stop");

Explanation:
- Long press of top right (the correct one) generates movemode=1 and movemode=0 at release.
- Long press of bottom right (the problematic one) generates movemode=3 and movemode=0 at release.

Open question:
- No idea whether this change does not affect any other devices of this class.

### How to reproduce it (minimal and precise)

Long press the bottom right button and compare the output to long pressing the top right button.

### Zigbee2MQTT version

2.3.0

### Adapter firmware version

20240710

### Adapter

ZBDongle-P TI CC2652P

### Setup

not relevant for the issue

_No response_

issues.title: New BSEED roller shutter switch is not exposing calibration, position and backlight options
issues.body:
### What happened?

Hi,

I have a well working (older) BSEED roller shutter switch in my system and now brought some new BSEED roller shutter switches and added them into z2m.

PROBLEM STATEMENT:
**The new switches are neither exposing the calibration function, nor position function, nor indicator nor are they having backlight options.**
I can't calibrate them at all. (I tried many options I found in internet, but none of them worked. - long press until blinking etc...)

The new switches are recognised as:
Model: TS0601
Manfacturer: _TZE284_uqfph8ah

The old (working switches) are recognised like this:
Model: TS130F
Manfacturer: _TZ3000_vsj5o7dm

SOLUTION IDEA:
---> Does it make sense to force detecting the new ones as "old" models?
If yes, how can I do that?

Is there any other fix?


### What did you expect to happen?

I expect that the roller switches expose all the "old" options that the TS130F have.

### How to reproduce it (minimal and precise)

Pair new roller shutter switches and see that there are no options, other than open / close (for the fixed preset time)

### Zigbee2MQTT version

2.6.1

### Adapter firmware version

20240716

### Adapter

SLZB

### Setup

Using Z2M add-on on HomeAssistant on virtual machine.

issues.title: [Feature request]: Allow scheduling a configurations change operations (for example bind/unbind)
issues.body:
### Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe

A little bit. Some devices are troublesome to bind, as they are not "always on". Regular battery powered buttons require you to press it around the same time you make a binding. This is not too much of a problem, but sometimes a bit inconvenient, when you want to reconfigure something in the other end of the house.

A bigger problem is devices that don't have a specific activation time, such as room sensors if you want to modify the reporting interval, or a PIR sensor if you want to bind it to a light. The rooms sensors only wake up sometimes to report the current temperature and humidity, which makes it really hard to time a configuration update. The PIR sensor obviously wakes up when movement is detected, but if I'm adding a binding to it while sitting at my computer, then it's kind of hard to run out and trigger it, to wake it up...

### Describe the solution you'd like

I would like to be able to schedule configuration updates, such as bindings, and reporting intervals.

[Recently OTA updates gained this functionality](https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee2mqtt/pull/26823), and it works fantastically, it's super easy to schedule an update, and know that the update will run whenever the device is available. Fire-and-forget is absolutely brilliant. I basically want the same for all the other kinds of configuration changes.

### Describe alternatives you've considered

I haven't really considered any alternatives, I currently just deal with the uncertainty of when the devices wake up.

### Additional context

N/A

issues.title: After update from 1.35.0 to 2.6.0 -> Z2M starts but fully empty even the version and coordinator fields
issues.body:
### What happened?

Hi to all, 
Please Help, My entire house is in darkness and I have guests coming over tonight.  :'(

I wanted to upgrade from version 1.35.0 to the latest version 2.6.0 of Z2M.

My setup is:
- An HP Elite NUC with Proxmox. HA in VM. And MQTT and Z2M in Docker containers that I manage with Portainer. 

Following the upgrade instructions on the Z2M installation page on Docker: https://www.zigbee2mqtt.io/guide/installation/02_docker.html#running-the-container

I now have Z2M running on Onboarding. I filled it out and clicked Submit. 
But it didn't start, so I went to configuration.yaml to switch it to onboarding: FALSE.

Now I have the Z2M Frontend page, but everything is empty, even the ‘About’ page, where there is no Z2M version number, no coordinator, nothing. 

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/9b30c3f1-e854-422f-8b48-6da01a96afd1)

### What did you expect to happen?

What I need is to retrieve all my zigbee peripherals in this new 2.6.0 and recover functions with MQTT server and HA.

### How to reproduce it (minimal and precise)

_No response_

### Zigbee2MQTT version

2.6.0

don't know yet

conbee III

HP Elite NUC with Proxmox. HA in VM. And MQTT and Z2M in Docker containers that I manage with Portainer.

issues.title: Group on/off status does not always update correctly
issues.body: ### What happened? When I turn on the lights in a group (individually, not as a group), the status of that group does not always update. Sometimes it shows as on, sometimes as off. ### What did you expect to happen? I expect that the group on/off status aligns with my settings of that group. ### How to reproduce it (minimal and precise) 1. Create a light group 2. Turn on lights individually ### Zigbee2MQTT version 2.6.0 ### Adapter firmware version 7.4.4 ### Adapter EmberZNet ### Setup I run z2m as a docker container on an RPI5 64bit ### Device `database.db` entry _No response_ ### Debug log _No response_

issues.title: [TS011F / _TZ3210_raqjcxo5] - Mercator Ikuü SPP02G Double power point - turns off/on when Zigbee2mqtt offline
issues.body:
<!-- MAKE SURE THIS IS NOT ALREADY POSTED https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee2mqtt/issues -->

### What happened?
When zigbee2mqtt is down, the power point will randomly flick off/on both outlets. It seems to occur most frequently just after zigbee2mqtt goes offline, then settles down to around once every hour or so. This does not occur when it is paired with the Mercator hub and the Mercator hub is taken offline.

### What did you expect to happen?
Outlets remain on

### How to reproduce it (minimal and precise)
Pair device with Zigbee2mqtt, shut down Zigbee2mqtt, wait a few minutes and it'll start glitching.

### Debug logs

Seeing an available OTA update for [TS011F_plug_1](https://www.zigbee2mqtt.io/devices/TS011F_plug_1.html#tuya-ts011f_plug_1), update is suspicious to begin with (installed version 192, available version 82)
Trying to install it throws error:

issues.title: Door Sensor (Ihseno ZC-W1) recognized as Humidity/Temperature Sensor in Zigbee2MQ
issues.body:
### What happened?

I have a door sensor by Ihseno, model code ZC-W1, which is being recognized by Zigbee2MQTT as a humidity and temperature sensor, rather than a contact/door sensor. This happens regardless of firmware or restart, and the device is always listed as “ZC-W1” after pairing. I have already tried overwriting the configuration and setting the device class manually, but this has no effect—the entity is always created as a humidity/temperature sensor.
There is a temperature and humidity sensor by Ihenso wit the same code in the Zigbee2MQTT database.  Is there an option or workaround to force Zigbee2MQTT or MQTT Discovery to correctly treat the sensor as a door/contact sensor? Or is native support for this model planned?
Thank you for your help!

### What did you expect to happen?

the sensor to be recognized as a door sensor

### How to reproduce it (minimal and precise)

at every pairing, independent of overwriting

### Zigbee2MQTT version

2.6.1-1

### Adapter firmware version

EmberZNet 7.4.3 [GA]

### Adapter

Ember Adapter (Silicon Labs basierend)

### Setup

Home assistant, RasberryPI 5 with Home Assistant

issues.title: LYWSD03MMC-z incorecct max value for Measurement interval
issues.body: ### What happened? The Measurement interval allows a max of 30s, while accordingly to PVVX this is 255 Attr: 0x0107, UINT8 (id:0x20), Measurement interval, range: 3..255 seconds. Default 10 seconds. source: https://github.com/pvvx/ZigbeeTLc ### What did you expect to happen? Max can be set to 255s ### How to reproduce it (minimal and precise) - Go to the device - Select 'Exposes' tab - Scroll down till 'Measurement interval' - Observe the slider max value Documentation page is also mentioning max=30s https://www.zigbee2mqtt.io/devices/LYWSD03MMC-z.html ### Zigbee2MQTT version 2.6.1 ### Adapter firmware version 7.4.5 [GA] ### Adapter EmberZNet ### Setup Home Assistant OS Addon ### Device `database.db` entry _No response_ ### Debug log _No response_

issues.title: SONOFF ZBMINIR2 not expose input switch state
issues.body:
### What happened?

It should publish the input state and the output state, but it only publishes the "state" property, which displays the output value, and the "action" property, which displays the output value, or "toggle" if the input has ever changed relative to the output.
Operating in "Detach relay mode": true, the output operates independently of the input, and without knowing the input state, it makes it difficult to use the device.

### What did you expect to happen?

By changing to the ZHA communication, I have tested that it generates a Switch for this device to read and write the output status, and a binary_sensor to read the input state and they work correctly as expected, so I understand that it is a problem with the Zigbee2MQTT implementation.

### How to reproduce it (minimal and precise)

Set "Detach relay mode": true and change the state of the physical switch connected to the input, and it is clearly seen that it does not publish any properties in which the state of the input is seen

### Zigbee2MQTT version

2.6.1

### Adapter firmware version

8.0.2 [GA]

### Adapter

SMLIGHT SLZB-06M

### Setup

Raspberry Pi 4 Home Assistant OS 

### Device `database.db` entry

issues.title: [BUG?] Gledopto GL-SD-001P physical button / z2m behaviour
issues.body:
### What happened?

Hi,

I have two of the mentioned Zigbee Triac dimmers since 3-4 weeks now. Today I found the odd behaviour, that pushing the physical button does not the same behaviour (when switching off) as z2m seems to do.

When pushing the button:
- state switches to "off" or "on"

When switching the light from z2m
- state switches to "off" _and brightness gets set to 1._
- state switches to "on" _and brightness gets set to 254._

Because of this behaviour, when I switch off the lights from z2m, I cant switch them back on from the physical push button, because the brightness value is 1, instead of the old value 254 (when they where on).

Could this behaviour be switched to match the behaviour of the physical push button, so not actively changing the brightness value in z2m?

Thanks in advance
hasechris

### What did you expect to happen?

that z2m does not change the brightness value when switching off/on.

### How to reproduce it (minimal and precise)

seems to be the normal behaviour in the production z2m

### Zigbee2MQTT version

2.6.1

### Adapter firmware version

20220219

### Adapter

tubesZB CC2652 Ethernet (https://github.com/tube0013/tube_gateways/tree/main/models/current/tubeszb-cc2652-eth_usb)

### Setup

Z2M via Homeassistant Addon.
Homeassistant is HAOS as a VM on Proxmox hypervisor

issues.title: new web-based setup doesn't use port that was specified by environment variable
issues.body:
### What happened?

I'm just about to writing the new setup-routine for installing z2m v2 in openhab.
I did set the port as an environment variable so that it's correctly written in the configuration.yaml. But still the server is starting on 8080 with the initial setup.

This is not good as 8080 is occupied by openhab. If I kill openhab and open the page on 8080 the initial setup page shows the new port in the field port but it's not yet used as the port for the web-based setup. I assume this only works after the complete initial setup (with correct serial adapter etc.).

Unfortunately it won't work to ask the users to stop openhab, install z2m, restart z2m and then restart openhab. 
Do you see a solution that the initial setup is directly starting with the port that is specified in the environment variable?

### What did you expect to happen?

My expected behaviour would be:
If I start z2m for the first time with:
ZIGBEE2MQTT_CONFIG_FRONTEND_PORT="8081"  pnpm start &
Then the initial web based setup directly starts with port 8081.

### How to reproduce it (minimal and precise)

make a fresh install and start z2m with
ZIGBEE2MQTT_CONFIG_FRONTEND_PORT="8081"  pnpm start &

### Zigbee2MQTT version

2.6.1

### Adapter firmware version

20210120

### Adapter

zig-a-zig-a

### Setup

Pi5,

issues.title: Sonoff SNZB-01P + IKEA Somrig button → action always stays N/A
issues.body:
<!-- MAKE SURE THIS IS NOT ALREADY POSTED https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee2mqtt/issues -->

### What happened?

Both the Sonoff SNZB-01P (fw 2.2.0) and IKEA Somrig button pair successfully, show battery/voltage/linkquality correctly, but action always stays N/A.
No action events appear in Zigbee2MQTT logs when pressing the buttons (not even “unsupported command”).

### What did you expect to happen?

When pressing a button, Zigbee2MQTT should publish an MQTT message with action (e.g. single, double, hold) and the logs should show incoming events.

### How to reproduce it (minimal and precise)

Pair a Sonoff SNZB-01P (fw 2.2.0, 20230908) or IKEA Somrig button with Zigbee2MQTT (coordinator SLZB-06, firmware ZStack3x0 20250321).

Verify that battery, voltage, linkquality are shown in Exposes.

Press the button → action remains N/A, no events in logs.

issues.title: [Feature request]: Support for TS0049 / Haozee Tuya Water Valve – vendor-specific countdown (Cluster 0xE001, Command 0xFE)
issues.body:
### Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe

I am integrating the Haozee / Tuya water valve (TS0049, _TZ3000_kz1anoi8).
This device supports a countdown function which requires sending a vendor-specific Zigbee command:

Cluster: 0xE001 (manuSpecificTuya3)

Frame Control: 0x11 (cluster-specific, no manufacturer, default response disabled)

Command ID: 0xFE

Payload: 0B || UInt32BE(seconds) (DP = 0x0B, 4-byte big endian value)

Example sniffer capture for a 60 second countdown:
`... 11 0C FE 0B 00 00 00 3C`

Currently Zigbee2MQTT converters cannot send this frame.

endpoint.command() fails with Cluster 'manuSpecificTuya3' has no command '254', because herdsman validates against the ZCL catalog.

External converters cannot patch herdsman’s ZCL definitions, and they cannot access controller.request() to send raw frames.

So I am stuck: the device requires a raw frame, but there is no way to send it from a converter.

### Describe the solution you'd like

One of the following options would solve the problem:

Expose a raw send API in Zigbee2MQTT (e.g. endpoint.commandRaw(...) or a bridge action like zigbee2mqtt/bridge/request/raw_zcl) that allows sending a complete ZCL frame buffer without validation.

Expose the herdsman controller to external converters, so I can call controller.request(...) directly and build the raw frame myself.

(less ideal) Extend the herdsman ZCL catalog to include cluster 0xE001 / command 0xFE.

### Describe alternatives you've considered

I tried to use endpoint.command(0xE001, 0xFE, …) → fails due to ZCL validation.

I tried to patch the ZCL catalog inside an external converter → not possible, herdsman modules are not exported in Z2M runtime.

I tried to access controller.request() from a converter → not exposed by Z2M, so null.

### Additional context

Device: Haozee / Tuya water valve, TS0049, _TZ3000_kz1anoi8.

Countdown datapoint is DP 0x0B.

Required payload format confirmed via Wireshark sniffing.

A raw send API would not only help with this device but also other Tuya devices requiring vendor-specific frames.

issues.title: zh:ember:ezsp: The adapter has run out of buffers
issues.body:
### What happened?

This was working fine approx 2 days ago but I think it started when I sent 69 messages in quick succession from home assistant - I was testing "turn off all lights".  Since then I continually receive "zh:ember:ezsp: The adapter has run out of buffers."  This has slowed down my zigbee2mqtt considerably.  I can no longer pair any new devices even devices I removed cannot be repaired.
I have power cycled adapter.
I have power cycled unbuntu server
I have power cycled home assistant server.
I have reflashed the firmware on the adapter
I have powered off all the devices from the fuse box and then slowly turned them on 1 at a time.
I have filtered out as much as I can think of in configuration.yaml

issues.title: fix: Fix `DatabaseEntry with ID 'X' does not exist` when adding device to delete group ID
issues.body:
This fixes an issue that in case a group is deleted and a new group is created with the same ID a `Failed to add from group (DatabaseEntry with ID 'X' does not exist)` error is thrown. This is because z2m still has the old group object in memory while zh created a different one with a different databaseId.

Fixes https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee2mqtt/issues/23929

issues.title: ZG2819S-RGBW action event entity does not update
issues.body:
### What happened?

I am running zigbee2mqtt as HomeAssistant addon. I have paired an Illuminizer-branded ZG2819S-RGBW with z2m. I have activated the experimental event action entities (config option `experimental_event_entities`).

When I press any button on the ZG2819S-RGBW remote, the "Link Quality", "Last Seen" and "Battery" entities in Home Assistant update, however, the event entity does not. In fact, according to the home assistant entity history, it has never not been unknown, see example screenshots below.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/a78d20d3-bad6-45e5-b2de-57b75a1d85d7)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/b79f4f0e-0d41-4107-be46-ad995e342058)

The "states" view in the developer indicates that it knows the events possible values but also indicates that the entity was never updated:

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/e3bd0869-305d-413f-a9b6-57a61dd0ab90)

However, when I check the z2m logs, it is clear that the action is within the logged payload:

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/df5aa8f9-e873-4dcd-8a5f-e7b30473b0dd)

Also when checking the "MQTT Info" page of the device in HomeAssistant, the action seems to be visible within the MQTT payload, it just does not make it into the event entity:

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/673b8702-3480-493f-b02b-3dfbdf09a662)

### What did you expect to happen?

The action event entity should change its value 

### How to reproduce it (minimal and precise)

1. Get the remote
2. Pair it to z2m
3. Activate the experimental event entities
4. Press any button on the remote an observe no update to event entity

### Zigbee2MQTT version

2.6.1

### Adapter firmware version

7.4.4.0 build 0 (EZSP v13)

### Adapter

Sonoff ZBDongle v2

### Setup

Addon running in HomeAssistant running within ProxMox 

### Device `database.db` entry

_No response_

### Debug log

_No response_

issues.title: Frient SMSZB-120 smokecdetector draining battery
issues.body:
### What happened?

Ref https://www.zigbee2mqtt.io/devices/SMSZB-120.html

I notice a huge battery drain with these detectors even with good quality Energizer CR123 batteries (depleted in one month)

I reported the issue to Frient as I do not have the issue with other battery operated sensors.

This is their reply:
==================
We received a few similar observations from the customers, and what connected them is Zigbee2MQTT integration.

We’re not in control of what’s within their converters, such as polling configuration, etc.. However, this platform seems to be the only one where customers experience similar behavior.

I believe there are only two possible scenarios for why the device uses the battery so fast:

- When it constantly loses connection with the gateway, causing the device to reconnect frequently, and therefore, not “sleeping”.
- When the gateway is constantly “talking” to the device, requesting updates on, e.g., temperature.
 
Perhaps you could try to move the device a little bit closer to the gateway for a test, or use a Zigbee range extending device in between.
.
===========
.
I do not know how to check of the device os constantly reconnecting.
I do notice regular temperature updates but ot seems those are triggered from the device. I di have extenders within 2m range of ywo devices. The 3rd device is within 1m of my (Sonoff) dongle. 
As said, none of my other battery powered sensors (Tuya and Aqara) suffer from issues like this. It is only the Grient devices that jave these issues.
Looking for suggestion.....
Incl suggestion to force the number of data elements transmitted.

### What did you expect to happen?

_No response_

### How to reproduce it (minimal and precise)

_No response_

### Zigbee2MQTT version

1.39.0

### Adapter firmware version

20230507

### Adapter

zStack3x0

### Setup

Stand-alone on RaspberryPi running Raspbian

issues.title: EventBus error 'OnEvent/deviceMessage': Cannot destructure property 'device' of 'event.data' as it is undefined
issues.body:
### What happened?

Hi,

I have some issues re-pairing devices which used to work properly in the past, namely a Xiaomi Aqara WSDCGQ11LM (a single one, I have multiple of them and the rest are working fine, also tried with new battery) which will simply never show up and a ZLinky TIC device, which can be paired but appears as "unsupported device". 

Not sure if related, but I see the following error in the log when trying to pair these devices.

```
error 2025-09-10 11:38:54z2m: EventBus error 'OnEvent/deviceMessage': Cannot destructure property 'device' of 'event.data' as it is undefined.
```

Coordinator is a Sonoff ZBDongle-P, running ZStack3x0 version 20250321.

### What did you expect to happen?

This error should not happen, and devices should be able to pair and be recognized as supported.

Also tried with Zigbee2MQTT  2.6.1-dev commit: [5063c7d3](https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee2mqtt/commit/5063c7d3) with same result.

### How to reproduce it (minimal and precise)

* Install zigbee2mqtt following the instructions in https://www.zigbee2mqtt.io/guide/installation/01_linux.html
* Switch to pairing mode (either all or coordinator only)
* Try to pair the Aqara device (or ZLinky TIC)

2.6.1 commit: 5063c7d3

### Adapter firmware version

20250321

Sonoff ZBDongle-P

Countdown (numeric)

issues.title: Tuya TS0505B_1_1 bulb not responding to state switch (on/off issue)
issues.body:
### What happened?

The Tuya TS0505B_1_1 Zigbee bulb does not behave correctly when toggled on/off.

When turning on the bulb via Home Assistant/Zigbee2MQTT switch (light.turn_on), the bulb immediately turns itself off.

The bulb only turns on successfully if brightness is included in the command (e.g., increasing/decreasing brightness).

Turning off the bulb works normally.

### What did you expect to happen?

**Expected Behavior:**

The bulb should turn on and stay on when triggered via a standard on command.

Brightness should not be required for the bulb to remain on.

### How to reproduce it (minimal and precise)

Steps to Reproduce

1.  Pair Tuya TS0505B_1_1 bulb.
2.  Try turning on the bulb via HA/Z2M switch (light.turn_on).
3.  Observe the bulb turning on briefly, then off again.
4.  Instead, turn on the bulb with a brightness value — works correctly.

### Zigbee2MQTT version

2.6.1

### Adapter firmware version

7.4.3 [GA]

### Adapter

EmberZNet 

### Setup

I am running it on Pi 4 on HAOS via add-on

### Device `database.db` entry

_No response_

issues.title: zhc:tuya: Failed respond to version response
issues.body:
### What happened?

Tuya MCU version request fails with timeout errors, e.g.:

zhc:tuya: Failed respond to version response '0xa4c138018b819df8' (Error: ZCL command 0xa4c138018b819df8/1 manuSpecificTuya.mcuVersionRequest({"seq":2}, {"timeout":10000,"disableResponse":false,"disableRecovery":false,"disableDefaultResponse":false,"direction":0,"reservedBits":0,"writeUndiv":false}) failed (Delivery failed for '30694'.))


When the full network (~70 devices, mostly Zemismart ZMS-206US-4 end devices) is powered on, the adapter runs out of buffers:

error 2025-09-10 17:12:19zh:ember:ezsp: The adapter has run out of buffers, causing general malfunction. Remediate network congestion, if present. Last Frame: [FRAME: ID=52:"SEND_UNICAST" Seq=103 Len=10]. - should I log another issue for this?  I'm getting several of these after I power on approx 1/3rd of my devices (I turned the power off at the fuse box then powered on 1 at a time with a 3 minute gap).  I disabled mqtt in home assistant, reinstalled the firmware, power cycled unbuntu server and adapter and still getting these messages.  I think it started when home assistant sent 69 messages at once and it hasn't recovered.


The fix suggested in issue #23874 does not resolve the problem.

With the error "The adapter has run out of buffers," I filtered out the following on configuration.yaml thinking this might have been the cause
mqtt:

  server: mqtt://localhost:1883

    - 24

    - 41

  ext_pan_id:
    - 72
    - 193
    - 107
    - 141
    - 206
    - 8
    - 1
    - 37
  queue_rate_limit: 5
  cache_state: true
  last_seen: ISO_8601
  elapsed: true
  transmit_power: 13
  network_key_distribute: true
frontend:
  enabled: true
  port: 8080
homeassistant:
  enabled: true
external_converters:
  - ext_converter.js
device_options:
  debounce: 5
  throttle: 60
  filtered_attributes:
    - backlight_brightness
    - backlight_mode
    - child_lock
    - countdown_l1
    - countdown_l2
    - countdown_l3
    - countdown_l4
    - delay_off_schedule
    - indicator_status

    - switch_color_on

    - illuminance_average_20min

    - update
    - detection_delay
    - fading_time
    - maximum_range

    - radar_sensitivity
    - target_distance
    - cleaning_reminder

### What did you expect to happen?

The Tuya MCU version requests should succeed, and the EZSP adapter should handle the network without buffer exhaustion, even with all devices powered on.

### How to reproduce it (minimal and precise)

Set up a Zigbee network with approximately 70 devices, about 60 of which are Zemismart ZMS-206US-4 end devices.

Use the SLZB-MR4 (EFR32MG26) coordinator with firmware 20240602 connected via Ethernet.

Power on all devices and observe logs.

Use zigbee2mqtt dev branch.

### Zigbee2MQTT version

2.6.1-dev

### Adapter firmware version

20240602 

### Adapter

SLZB-MR4 (EFR32MG26) connected via Ethernet.

### Setup

Intel NUC with proxmox and unbuntu server running both zigbee2mqtt and mqtt broker

issues.title: The project depends on simple-swizzle, my antivirus deletes it, z2m does not start.
issues.body:
### What happened?

The zigbee2mqtt latest release (2.6.1) depends on `color@3.2.1`. This package depends transitively on `simple-swizzle` (the chain is `color` - `color-string` - `simple-swizzle`) in the [pnpm lockfile](https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee2mqtt/blob/d44463a330867e97129476f3eb5e5a3b6334ab33/pnpm-lock.yaml#L1971), it states 0.2.2 for simple-swizzle, which is not affected. Maybe it updates automatically if i do not add `--frozen-lockfile` after `pnpm install` ?

My antivirus deletes the dependency from the z2m folder because of this, and the project cannot be started.

If I understand the situation correctly, this will be resolved as soon as NPM deletes the vulnerable versions of qix's libraries, and the antivirus unflags older versions of the library.

### What did you expect to happen?

_No response_

### How to reproduce it (minimal and precise)

_No response_

### Zigbee2MQTT version

2.6.1

### Adapter firmware version

-

### Adapter

-

### Setup

Z2M latest release, installed on Windows.

_No response_

_No response_

issues.title: Connection with device other than dev/ttyUSB
issues.body:
### What happened?

My SBC has connected 2 usb devices, first is pl2303, second is cp210x. Each of them gets standard names:

pl2303  -> /dev/ttyUSB0 
and 
cp210x -> /dev/ttyUSB1.
After restart sometimes they are exchanging names, so ttyUSB0 becomes ttyUSB1, and ttyUSB1 becomes ttyUSB0.
Problem is that I can't use /dev/cp210x device with Zigbee2mqtt. I have to use only ttyUSB device from /dev tree.


### What did you expect to happen?

I'd like to use /dev/cp210x as serial device for zigbee2mqtt in exchange of /dev/ttyUSB0

### How to reproduce it (minimal and precise)

Create link for serial device in the /dev tree. Try to connect with zigbee2mqtt to that link.

### Zigbee2MQTT version

2.2.1

20230507

Sonoff ZBDongle-P

issues.title: [New device support] LS 756200643 remote
issues.body:
<!-- MAKE SURE THIS IS NOT ALREADY POSTED https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee2mqtt/issues -->

### Link
https://www.opo.de/medias/Montageanleitung-1504960-Mec-Driver-1-Kanal-Modul.pdf?context=bWFzdGVyfHJvb3R8MTA4NTgxMXxhcHBsaWNhdGlvbi9wZGZ8YURjM0wyaGtNQzg0T1RZNU5EWXpNVFk1TURVMEwwMXZiblJoWjJWaGJteGxhWFIxYm1jZ01UVXdORGsyTUNCTlpXTWdSSEpwZG1WeUlERXRTMkZ1WVd3Z1RXOWtkV3d1Y0dSbXxhYjYzNWUwZTM4Zjc2ZTE4ZDI2NWI2ZGZjZmE4YmY0NjRhNjA4M2I2YmM4YjVjOGMwMWVmNGE0NDhiMDg5N2Q0

### What does/doesn't work with the external definition?
identifies as SEMOTE from Bweetech

working:
On
Off

temp button
color_temperature_step_up (short press)
color_temperature_step_down (long press)

Sun button alternates between:
brightness_step_up
brightness_step_down

NOT WORKING:
1/2/3/4 buttons (grouped circles left half of the remote)

### Details
zigbee-herdsman-converters: `25.14.0`
software_build_id: `4.6.07_016`
date_code: ``
endpoints:
```json
{"1":{"bindings":[],"clusters":{"input":["genBasic","genPowerCfg","genIdentify","genGroups","touchlink"],"output":["genIdentify","genGroups","genScenes","genOnOff","genLevelCtrl","lightingColorCtrl","touchlink"]},"configured_reportings":[],"scenes":[]}}
```

### External definition:
```ts
import * as m from 'zigbee-herdsman-converters/lib/modernExtend';

export default {
    zigbeeModel: ['SEMOTE'],
    model: 'SEMOTE',
    vendor: 'Bweetech',
    description: 'Automatically generated definition',
    extend: [m.battery(), m.commandsOnOff(), m.commandsLevelCtrl(), m.commandsColorCtrl()],
    meta: {},
};

```

issues.title: TS110E (dimmer module) does not report correct state
issues.body: ### What happened? The module ([link to specific module](https://www.zigbee2mqtt.io/devices/TS110E_1gang_2.html#tuya-ts110e_1gang_2)) reports that the lights are on when they are off. Otherwise it works fine, both when operated with the actual switch and when operated through Z2M. When the lights are turned off, it will report that as well, but after some time (this differs between 15 minutes and 1 hour after turning them off) it will report the state as on. The lights themselves stay off. ### What did you expect to happen? I expected that the state would stay "off" when the lights are not turned on. ### How to reproduce it (minimal and precise) Install module and register to Z2M network. Turn lights off and wait for about an hour. ### Zigbee2MQTT version 2.6.1 ### Adapter firmware version 7.4.5 [GA] ### Adapter SONOFF ZBDongle-E ### Setup Z2M runs as a seperate LXC on Proxmox 9.0.6. Output of the requested command: Linux zigbee2mqtt 6.14.11-1-pve #1 SMP PREEMPT_DYNAMIC PMX 6.14.11-1 (2025-08-26T16:06Z) x86_64 GNU/Linux Debian GNU/Linux 12 ### Device `database.db` entry {"friendly_name": "Lamp keuken","ieee_address": "0xa4c138e83bd458c7","interview_completed": true,"interview_state": "SUCCESSFUL","interviewing": false,"manufacturer": "_TZ3210_k1msuvg6","model_id": "TS110E","network_address": 23990,"power_source": "Mains (single phase)","supported": true,"type": "Router"} ### Debug log

issues.title: [TS0505B / _TZB210_417ikxay] Not keeping color mode when re-toggle device
issues.body:
<!-- MAKE SURE THIS IS NOT ALREADY POSTED https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee2mqtt/issues -->

### What happened?
Color power on behavior is not working properly
When i turn off my led controller, for example it's color is blue, when it is on it is forgets the previous color and becames red.
But programmatically - z2m still thinks that it displays previous color and brightness.
Also, it seems that it tries to restore not color mode, but color temperature, because, when i tried to change the color temp, and then changed the color itself and on/offed the device - it turned on with the last color mode.
Was working properly before 2.6.0

### What did you expect to happen?
Device should keep previous color mode.

### How to reproduce it (minimal and precise)
- Set desired color
- Turn device off
- Turn device on

### Debug logs

### Details
os: `#1711 SMP PREEMPT Thu Dec 21 14:27:49 GMT 2023 - 6.1.69-v8+ - arm64`
node: `v22.16.0`
zigbee2mqtt: `2.6.1` (`unknown`)
zigbee-herdsman: `6.0.4`
zigbee-herdsman-converters: `25.14.0`
adapter: `EmberZNet` `{"build":397,"ezsp":14,"major":8,"minor":0,"patch":2,"revision":"8.0.2 [GA]","special":0,"type":170}`

Bumps the minor-patch group with 3 updates: [mqtt](https://github.com/mqttjs/MQTT.js), [@biomejs/biome](https://github.com/biomejs/biome/tree/HEAD/packages/@biomejs/biome) and [@types/node](https://github.com/DefinitelyTyped/DefinitelyTyped/tree/HEAD/types/node). Updates `mqtt` from 5.14.0 to 5.14.1
Release notes

Release 5.14.1

5.14.1 (2025-09-04)

Bug Fixes

  • isWebWorkerEnv check for Deno environment (#2023) (a6e74ad)
Changelog

Sourced from mqtt's changelog.

5.14.1 (2025-09-04)

Commits
  • ab2ed39 chore(release): 5.14.1
  • fe45405 fix(connect/ws): ensure proxy stream is writable (#2024)
  • a6e74ad fix: isWebWorkerEnv check for Deno environment (#2023)
  • See full diff in compare view

Updates `@biomejs/biome` from 2.2.2 to 2.2.3
Release notes

Sourced from @​biomejs/biome's releases.

Biome CLI v2.2.3

2.2.3

Patch Changes

  • #7353 4d2b719 Thanks @​JeetuSuthar! - Fixed #7340: The linter now allows the navigation property for view-transition in CSS.

    Previously, the linter incorrectly flagged navigation: auto as an unknown property. This fix adds navigation to the list of known CSS properties, following the CSS View Transitions spec.

  • #7275 560de1b Thanks @​arendjr! - Fixed #7268: Files that are explicitly passed as CLI arguments are now correctly ignored if they reside in an ignored folder.

  • #7358 963a246 Thanks @​ematipico! - Fixed #7085, now the rule noDescendingSpecificity correctly calculates the specificity of selectors when they are included inside a media query.

  • #7387 923674d Thanks @​qraqras! - Fixed #7381, now the useOptionalChain rule recognizes optional chaining using Yoda expressions (e.g., undefined !== foo && foo.bar).

  • #7316 f9636d5 Thanks @​Conaclos! - Fixed #7289. The rule useImportType now inlines import type into import { type } when the style option is set to inlineType.

    Example:

    import type { T } from "mod";
// becomes
import { type T } from "mod";

  • #7350 bb4d407 Thanks @​siketyan! - Fixed #7261: two characters ・ (KATAKANA MIDDLE DOT, U+30FB) and ･ (HALFWIDTH KATAKANA MIDDLE DOT, U+FF65) are no longer considered as valid characters in identifiers. Property keys containing these character(s) are now preserved as string literals.

  • #7377 811f47b Thanks @​ematipico! - Fixed a bug where the Biome Language Server didn't correctly compute the diagnostics of a monorepo setting, caused by an incorrect handling of the project status.

  • #7245 fad34b9 Thanks @​kedevked! - Added the new lint rule useConsistentArrowReturn.

    This rule enforces a consistent return style for arrow functions.

    Invalid

    const f = () => {
  return 1;
};

    This rule is a port of ESLint's arrow-body-style rule.

  • #7370 e8032dd Thanks @​fireairforce! - Support dynamic import defer and import source. The syntax looks like:

    import.source("foo");
import.source("x", { with: { attr: "val" } });
import.defer("foo");
import.defer("x", { with: { attr: "val" } });

... (truncated)

Changelog

Sourced from @​biomejs/biome's changelog.

2.2.3

Patch Changes

  • #7353 4d2b719 Thanks @​JeetuSuthar! - Fixed #7340: The linter now allows the navigation property for view-transition in CSS.

    Previously, the linter incorrectly flagged navigation: auto as an unknown property. This fix adds navigation to the list of known CSS properties, following the CSS View Transitions spec.

  • #7275 560de1b Thanks @​arendjr! - Fixed #7268: Files that are explicitly passed as CLI arguments are now correctly ignored if they reside in an ignored folder.

  • #7358 963a246 Thanks @​ematipico! - Fixed #7085, now the rule noDescendingSpecificity correctly calculates the specificity of selectors when they are included inside a media query.

  • #7387 923674d Thanks @​qraqras! - Fixed #7381, now the useOptionalChain rule recognizes optional chaining using Yoda expressions (e.g., undefined !== foo && foo.bar).

  • #7316 f9636d5 Thanks @​Conaclos! - Fixed #7289. The rule useImportType now inlines import type into import { type } when the style option is set to inlineType.

    Example:

    import type { T } from "mod";
// becomes
import { type T } from "mod";

  • #7350 bb4d407 Thanks @​siketyan! - Fixed #7261: two characters ・ (KATAKANA MIDDLE DOT, U+30FB) and ･ (HALFWIDTH KATAKANA MIDDLE DOT, U+FF65) are no longer considered as valid characters in identifiers. Property keys containing these character(s) are now preserved as string literals.

  • #7377 811f47b Thanks @​ematipico! - Fixed a bug where the Biome Language Server didn't correctly compute the diagnostics of a monorepo setting, caused by an incorrect handling of the project status.

  • #7245 fad34b9 Thanks @​kedevked! - Added the new lint rule useConsistentArrowReturn.

    This rule enforces a consistent return style for arrow functions.

    Invalid

    const f = () => {
  return 1;
};

    This rule is a port of ESLint's arrow-body-style rule.

  • #7370 e8032dd Thanks @​fireairforce! - Support dynamic import defer and import source. The syntax looks like:

    import.source("foo");
import.source("x", { with: { attr: "val" } });
import.defer("foo");
import.defer("x", { with: { attr: "val" } });

Sourced from actions/stale's changelog.

Changelog

[9.1.0]

What's Changed

  • Documentation update by @​Marukome0743 in actions/stale#1116
  • Add workflow file for publishing releases to immutable action package by @​Jcambass in actions/stale#1179
  • Update undici from 5.28.2 to 5.28.4 by @​dependabot in actions/stale#1150
  • Update actions/checkout from 3 to 4 by @​dependabot in actions/stale#1091
  • Update actions/publish-action from 0.2.2 to 0.3.0 by @​dependabot in actions/stale#1147
  • Update ts-jest from 29.1.1 to 29.2.5 by @​dependabot in actions/stale#1175
  • Update @​actions/core from 1.10.1 to 1.11.1 by @​dependabot in actions/stale#1191
  • Update @​types/jest from 29.5.11 to 29.5.14 by @​dependabot in actions/stale#1193
  • Update @​actions/cache from 3.2.2 to 4.0.0 by @​dependabot in actions/stale#1194

[9.0.0]

Breaking Changes

  1. Action is now stateful: If the action ends because of operations-per-run then the next run will start from the first unprocessed issue skipping the issues processed during the previous run(s). The state is reset when all the issues are processed. This should be considered for scheduling workflow runs.
  2. Version 9 of this action updated the runtime to Node.js 20. All scripts are now run with Node.js 20 instead of Node.js 16 and are affected by any breaking changes between Node.js 16 and 20.

What Else Changed

  1. Performance optimization that removes unnecessary API calls by @​dsame in #1033; fixes #792
  2. Logs displaying current GitHub API rate limit by @​dsame in #1032; addresses #1029

For more information, please read the action documentation and its section about statefulness

[4.1.1]

In scope of this release we updated actions/core to 1.10.0 for v4 and fixed issues operation count.

[8.0.0]

:warning: This version contains breaking changes :warning:

  • New option labels-to-remove-when-stale enables users to specify list of comma delimited labels that will be removed when the issue or PR becomes stale by @​panticmilos actions/stale#770
  • Skip deleting the branch in the upstream of a forked repo by @​dsame actions/stale#913
  • abort the build on the error by @​dsame in actions/stale#935

[7.0.0]

:warning: Breaking change :warning:

  • Allow daysBeforeStale options to be float by @​irega in actions/stale#841
  • Use cache in check-dist.yml by @​jongwooo in actions/stale#876
  • fix print outputs step in existing workflows by @​irega in actions/stale#859
  • Update issue and PR templates, add/delete workflow files by @​IvanZosimov in actions/stale#880
  • Update how stale handles exempt items by @​johnsudol in actions/stale#874

Bumps [actions/setup-node](https://github.com/actions/setup-node) from 4 to 5.
Release notes

Sourced from actions/setup-node's releases.

v5.0.0

What's Changed

Breaking Changes

  • Enhance caching in setup-node with automatic package manager detection by @​priya-kinthali in actions/setup-node#1348

This update, introduces automatic caching when a valid packageManager field is present in your package.json. This aims to improve workflow performance and make dependency management more seamless. To disable this automatic caching, set package-manager-cache: false

steps:
- uses: actions/checkout@v5
- uses: actions/setup-node@v5

issues.title: v2.6.1 crashing because zigbee-herdsman@6.0.4 cannot init with slzb-06
issues.body:
### What happened?

I updated my docker image from 2.5.1 to latest (2.6.1). In v2.6.1, the container would restart after failing to properly initialize zigbee-herdsman. 

zigbee-herdsman appears to be failing to read the adapter's NV memory 

2.5.1 is running zigbee-herdsman 4.3.1
2.6.1 is running zigbee-herdsman 6.0.4

### What did you expect to happen?

I expect the docker image to start.

### How to reproduce it (minimal and precise)

Using a stable instance of 2.5.1 and SLZB in Zigbee Coordinator mode, update the docker image to 2.6.1.

### Zigbee2MQTT version

2.6.1

### Adapter firmware version

20240710

### Adapter

SLZB-06

### Setup

Zigbee2MQTT is run as a docker image within a docker compose stack managed by Portainer. The docker compose stack is hosted on Ubuntu LTS 24.01 and later, LTS 24.04.3. The other containers in this compose include mosquitto, home assistant, esphome and nginx. The Zigbee2MQTT container does not have the 8088 port mapped externally, and is only accessible within the compose stack virtual network by other containers in that same stack.

_No response_

issues.title: Inovelli VZM31-SN and VZM36 ignore Transition option in Home Assistant light.turn_off command in v2.6.1
issues.body:
### What happened?

When calling `light.turn_off` with a transition time, the VZM31-SN or VZM36 turns off with the configured `RampRateOnToOffRemote` instead of the transition time provided to the action call.

### What did you expect to happen?

I expect that the light would transition from on to off in the amount of time provided by the action call. (This works in v2.6.0)

### How to reproduce it (minimal and precise)

1. Set `RampRateOnToOffRemote` to a low value (i.e. 10, which is 1s)
2. Call `light.turn_off` in home assistant, targetting the switch and using a transition time greater than `RampRateOnToOffRemote` (i.e. 10s)
3. See light turn off in `RampRateOnToOffRemote` seconds instead of the transition time

### Zigbee2MQTT version

2.6.1

### Adapter firmware version

20240710

### Adapter

Sonoff Zigbee 3.0 USB Dongle Plus ZBDongle-P

### Setup

Plain Z2M in Docker on x86-64 Debian 12

issues.body:
### Link

https://www.philips-hue.com/en-us/p/smart-button-smart-button/046677605773

### Database entry

{"id":33,"type":"EndDevice","ieeeAddr":"0x001788010fbc6ffd","nwkAddr":37724,"manufId":4107,"manufName":"Signify Netherlands B.V.","powerSource":"Battery","modelId":"RDM005","epList":[1],"endpoints":{"1":{"profId":260,"epId":1,"devId":2096,"inClusterList":[0,1,3,64512,4096],"outClusterList":[25,0,3,4,6,8,5,4096],"clusters":{"genPowerCfg":{"attributes":{"61441":3117,"61442":3008,"61443":3158,"batteryPercentageRemaining":200,"batteryVoltage":30}},"genBasic":{"attributes":{"modelId":"RDM005","manufacturerName":"Signify Netherlands B.V.","powerSource":3,"zclVersion":8,"appVersion":2,"stackVersion":1,"hwVersion":1,"dateCode":"20250207","swBuildId":"2.83.1"}}},"binds":[{"cluster":1,"type":"endpoint","deviceIeeeAddress":"0x00124b002e104da0","endpointID":1},{"cluster":6,"type":"endpoint","deviceIeeeAddress":"0x00124b002e104da0","endpointID":1},{"cluster":8,"type":"endpoint","deviceIeeeAddress":"0x00124b002e104da0","endpointID":1}],"configuredReportings":[{"cluster":1,"attrId":33,"minRepIntval":3600,"maxRepIntval":65000,"repChange":10}],"meta":{}}},"appVersion":2,"stackVersion":1,"hwVersion":1,"dateCode":"20250207","swBuildId":"2.83.1","zclVersion":8,"interviewCompleted":true,"interviewState":"SUCCESSFUL","meta":{"configured":332242049},"lastSeen":1757257588281}

### Zigbee2MQTT version

2.6.1

### Comments

Hue now has a new version of its smart buttons. The new version is not yet supported. 

### External definition

```shell
import * as m from 'zigbee-herdsman-converters/lib/modernExtend';

export default {
    zigbeeModel: ['RDM005'],
    model: 'RDM005',
    vendor: 'Signify Netherlands B.V.',
    description: 'Automatically generated definition',
    extend: [m.battery(), m.commandsOnOff(), m.commandsLevelCtrl()],
    meta: {},
};
```

### What does/doesn't work with the external definition?

While the old button has the events on, off, press, hold and release, the new one only has on and brightness step.

Hello,

I'm trying to update the firmware of my Sonoff Zigbee 3.0 USB Dongle Plus V2 (model with CC2652P chipset) but I'm having difficulty finding the correct firmware file despite extensive searching.

What I've tried:

Searched through the Z-Stack-firmware repository

Found various firmware versions but not the specific one for my dongle

Attempted to use CC1352P2_CC2652P_launchpad_coordinator_20231222.hex but download links fail

Checked multiple mirrors ([cdn.smarthomeprimer.com](https://cdn.smarthomeprimer.com/), zigbee.pity.one) - all have connectivity issues

My environment:

Home Assistant OS

Zigbee2MQTT add-on

Dongle path: /dev/serial/by-id/usb-Itead_Sonoff_Zigbee_3.0_USB_Dongle_Plus_V2_...-if00-port0

Request:
Could someone please provide:

The exact correct firmware filename for this dongle

A working download link that doesn't timeout

Any specific instructions for CC2652P flash procedure

Thank you for your help!

issues.title: Errors with Legrand 067755 on EmberZNet while working using ConBee2/RaspBee2
issues.body:
### What happened?

I’m experiencing an issue with my three Legrand 067755 devices when using Ember.

- With Conbee2, all buttons work perfectly.
- With Ember, at least one button (sometimes more) does not work.

The malfunctioning button is not always the same one.
When pressing a non-working button, I see the following error message:
```
zh:ember: Failed to register group '65516' in multicast table with status=INVALID_STATE.
```

When pressing a button that works, I see the expected MQTT publish message, for example:
```
z2m:mqtt: MQTT publish: topic 'zigbee2mqtt-slzb-2/legrand_switch_scenario_3', payload '{"action":"recall_1_1","action_group":65514,"battery":100,"linkquality":184,"update":{"installed_version":-1,"latest_version":-1,"state":null},"voltage":3000}'
z2m:mqtt: MQTT publish: topic 'zigbee2mqtt-slzb-2/legrand_switch_scenario_3/action', payload 'recall_1_1'
```

### What did you expect to happen?

Same behavior on all buttons with a correct message 

### How to reproduce it (minimal and precise)

- Pair Legrand 067755 with Ember.
- Press different buttons on the device.
- Observe that some buttons do not trigger MQTT messages and produce the INVALID_STATE error.

### Zigbee2MQTT version

2.6.1

### Adapter firmware version

Révision: 8.0.2 [GA]

### Adapter

SLZB-06M

### Setup

Home Assistant OS on Intel Nuc

issues.title: Aqara W100 / TH-S04D - Temperature threshold modification under 0.5°C not possible
issues.body:
<!-- MAKE SURE THIS IS NOT ALREADY POSTED https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee2mqtt/issues -->

### What happened?

The modification of the temperature threshold is not kept if set under 0.5 °C. When the threshold is set under 0.5°C (0.2 or 0.3 or 0.4 °C), it returns  automatically to 0.5°C, with no error in the log, the payload is sent without error. It works with thresholds greater than 0.5, like 0.7 or 1°C.
When the report by period is set, the temperature is returned with a temperature step much smaller than 0.2 °C.

Same with temperature and humidity periods, which cannot be set back to the original walue of 30s after modification. The value is now limited to 10s, the max value of the bracket in the frontend.


### What did you expect to happen?

To modify the temperature threshold to 0.2°C.

### How to reproduce it (minimal and precise)

Reduce the temp_threshold to 0.2°C in the frontend or in HA, it switches back automatically to 0.5°C.

```shell
          fingerprint: tuya.fingerprint("TS0601", ["_TZE284_yrwmnya3"]),
          model: "M9-zigbee-SL-2",

                  ...[0, 1, 2, 3, 4].map((i) => e.power_on_behavior().withAccess(ea.STATE_SET).withEndpoint(`l${i}`)),
```

issues.title: [Feature request]: Support Home Assistant's new More Info dialog for light groups
issues.body:
### Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe

In Home Assistant 2025.8 the "more info" dialog box allows for [individual control of grouped entities](https://github.com/home-assistant/frontend/pull/26187), depending on the integration. Currently, Z2M groups do not work with this feature.

### Describe the solution you'd like

This is feature is powered by the "entity_id" attribute being set on the grouped entity, which is a list of entity ids of the groups members. Z2M should populate this attribute for grouped entities, if technically feasible.

### Describe alternatives you've considered

The only alternative is to create native groups in homeassistant rather than in Z2M, but that defeats the advantages of setting groups up in Z2M itself.

### Additional context

Given the MQTT architecture, it's not clear to me if Z2M is aware, or can be made aware of, the entity ids of its devices in Home Assistant. In the event this is not feasible, it would still be nice to be able to define this field manually in the group creation screen.

issues.title: OnOff:StartUpOnOff attribute value 0xFF treated as invalid
issues.body:
### What happened?

When reading value of OnOff:StartUpOnOff attribute, its value of 0xFF is treated as "Not a value", which leads to "undefined" state of "power_on_behavior" expose.

### What did you expect to happen?

Attribute value is treated as "previous" in "power_on_behavior" expose

### How to reproduce it (minimal and precise)

For any Zigbee device with OnOff cluster and powerOnBehavior=true, set "power_on_behavior" to "previous".
Then read from "power_on_behavior".
In exposes the "power_on_behavior" becomes undefined

### Zigbee2MQTT version

2.6.1

### Adapter firmware version

8.0.2 [GA]

### Adapter

EmberZNet stick

### Setup

plain Z2M under MacOS

### Device `database.db` entry

_No response_

### Debug log

_No response_

issues.title: Fatal Python error: Segmentation fault in 2025.9.3
issues.body:
### The problem

Since updating to 2025.9.2 (and subsequently, to 2025.9.3) my HA has been randomly crashing and not restarting (thus far it's happened 3 times in the past 24 hours. 

In the main log there is nothing of concern. The fault log indicates a Python segmentation fault that starts with the fastdotcom integration, but if I am reading the dumps right, it looks to be a SSL library problem. MQTT client & Chromecast are also in this log

All 3 integrations are operational after the restart. 

There are no messages in the log related to the fastdotcom integration otherwise (except for the INFO messages while HA starts up) 

This is the last of the main log, no ERRORS observed at all ...

```2025-09-15 01:52:25.679 INFO (MainThread) [homeassistant.components.iss] Fetching iss data recovered
2025-09-15 01:52:25.754 INFO (MainThread) [hass_nabucasa.google_report_state] Timeout while waiting to receive message
2025-09-15 01:52:30.483 WARNING (SyncWorker_17) [py.warnings] /usr/local/lib/python3.13/site-packages/urllib3/connectionpool.py:2303: InsecureRequestWarning: Unverified HTTPS request is being made to host '192.168.1.221'. Adding certificate verification is strongly advised. See: https://urllib3future.readthedocs.io/en/latest/advanced-usage.html#tls-warnings
  warnings.warn(

2025-09-15 01:52:32.803 INFO (MainThread) [custom_components.area_occupancy.db] Successfully saved area data for entry_id: 01K3DDAK8PTQNTB1Q63MAC9BSC
```

issues.title: High memory usage during and after Backup
issues.body: ### The problem Hello. When Home Asistant make Backups (local abckup) the RAM memory usage increase and after backup is completed the memory is not freed. I'm running Home Asistant OS with 5 GB of RAM on Proxmox 9. See here the RAM usage: As you can see before the Backup the ram usage was about 3.19 GB, after Backup the ram usage is about 4.67 GB. Here the Backup page of HA, it shows the backup was made at 04:52 and this is the same time the memory increase and it's not freed. Here the current status of the memory: Many thanks. ### What version of Home Assistant Core has the issue? 2025.9.3 ### What was the last working version of Home Assistant Core? Don't know ### What type of installation are you running? Home Assistant OS ### Integration causing the issue _No response_ ### Link to integration documentation on our website _No response_ ### Diagnostics information _No response_ ### Example YAML snippet ```yaml ``` ### Anything in the logs that might be useful for us? ```txt ``` ### Additional information _No response_

issues.body:

## Breaking change
Nibe 2.18.0 changed water temperature source for correct one by nice spec which is few degrees hotter than previous one. 


## Proposed change
<!--

issues.title: ai_task.generate_data fails when Ollama uses the `gpt-oss` model with a `structure`
issues.body:
### The problem

When using the `ai_task.generate_data` action on Ollama with the `gpt-oss:20b` model with a `structure` provided, I get an error that reads `Failed to perform the action ai_task.generate_data. Last content in chat log is not an AssistantContent`. If I remove the `structure`, `gpt-oss:20b` is able to generate a response, and other Ollama models like `gemma3:27b` and `gemma3n:e4b` are able to generate responses both with and without `structure`. Please see the YAML section for a repro case.

### What version of Home Assistant Core has the issue?

core-2025.9.3

### What was the last working version of Home Assistant Core?

_No response_

### What type of installation are you running?

Home Assistant Container

### Integration causing the issue

ollama

### Link to integration documentation on our website

https://www.home-assistant.io/integrations/ollama/

### Diagnostics information

_No response_

### Example YAML snippet

```yaml
action: ai_task.generate_data
metadata: {}
data:
  task_name: Generate daily forecast
  entity_id: ai_task.gpt_oss
  instructions: >-
    the weather today is sunny with a high of 69f
  structure:
    jp:
      required: true
      description: The Japanese translation of the given sentence.
      selector:
        text: null
```

### Anything in the logs that might be useful for us?

```txt
2025-09-14 21:40:14.526 DEBUG (MainThread) [homeassistant.components.ollama.entity] Received response: model='gpt-oss:20b' created_at='2025-09-15T04:40:14.523655376Z' done=True done_reason='stop' total_duration=29797961771 load_duration=257523958 prompt_eval_count=116 prompt_eval_duration=5691149413 eval_count=122 eval_duration=23625874601 message=Message(role='assistant', content='', thinking=None, images=None, tool_calls=None)
```

issues.title: Unable to add new application credentials
issues.body:
### The problem

I have no application credentials currently configured, and when trying to add a new configuration, the "Add Application Credentials" dialogue box comes up with a spinning wheel and goes no further.

The browser console shows the following:

```
dialog-add-application-credential.ts:83 Uncaught (in promise) {code: 'unknown_error', message: 'Unknown error'}
_fetchConfig @ dialog-add-application-credential.ts:83
await in _fetchConfig
showDialog @ dialog-add-application-credential.ts:72
d @ make-dialog-manager.ts:141
await in d
(anonymous) @ make-dialog-manager.ts:221
a @ fire_event.ts:75
n @ show-dialog-add-application-credential.ts:21
_addApplicationCredential @ ha-config-application-credentials.ts:291
handleEvent @ lit-html.ts:2109
```

It looks like someone else might be having a very similar problem: https://github.com/home-assistant/core/issues/148935

2025.9.3

issues.title: ubus: add /etc/ethers scanner and SSL
issues.body:
<!--
  You are amazing! Thanks for contributing to our project!
  Please, DO NOT DELETE ANY TEXT from this template! (unless instructed).
-->
## Proposed change
<!--
  Describe the big picture of your changes here to communicate to the
  maintainers why we should accept this pull request. If it fixes a bug
  or resolves a feature request, be sure to link to that issue in the
  additional information section.
-->
Improvements for the OpenWrt (ubus) integration:
- Add new `ethers` `dhcp_software` for scanning hostnames from `/etc/ethers`. Very useful for APs that do not run a DHCP server but have their `/etc/ethers` regularly populated with the hostnames of their Wi-Fi clients
- Add `ssl` (default: `false`) and `verify_ssl` (default: `true`) options for SSL connection to ubus

issues.title: Opower PG&E fails setup and will not authenticate
issues.body:
### The problem

The opower integration with PG&E won't connect anymore. I've confirmed that i can sign in to the website, and there is no service outage there. Ever since the new MFA update, i've had to have an automation to reload the integration whenever it goes unavailable. That no longer seems to be working.

This is the error i get when it fails authentication (account string redacted):
`Failed setup, will retry: HTTP Error: 500 URL: https://pge.opower.com/ei/edge/apis/DataBrowser-v1/cws/cost/utilityAccount/xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx?aggregateType=day&startDate=2025-07-28T00%3A00%3A00-07%3A00&endDate=2025-09-15T00%3A00%3A00-07%3A00 Status: 500 Response: {"error":{"httpStatus":500,"serviceErrorCode":"UPSTREAM_ERROR","details":"Could not get rated costs and usages for utility account UUID: xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx"}}`

This might be a duplicate of #150952 but i didn't see any mention of this specific error there.

Probably worth noting, though, that i do frequently also see the `Token is empty` error in my logs.

### What version of Home Assistant Core has the issue?

core-2025.9.3

### What was the last working version of Home Assistant Core?

_No response_

### What type of installation are you running?

Home Assistant OS

### Integration causing the issue

opower

### Link to integration documentation on our website

https://www.home-assistant.io/integrations/opower/

### Diagnostics information

_No response_

```yaml

```


issues.title: Netatmo Air Quality Monitors not in Summaries of new Home Dashboard
issues.body: ### The problem When I open the new Home Dashboard and press Climate under Summaries, I get an empty screen. I suspect it means the entities of the Netatmo Smart Indoor Air Quality Monitors I have are not categorised as Climate Sensors in the new Home Dashboard and therefore not shown there. When I press the room where the corresponding Netatmo air quality monitor is located, I do see all the entities related to the Netatmo device, but just under the title of the device name and not under the category climate. ### What version of Home Assistant Core has the issue? 2025.9.3 ### What was the last working version of Home Assistant Core? _No response_ ### What type of installation are you running? Home Assistant OS ### Integration causing the issue Netatmo ### Link to integration documentation on our website https://www.home-assistant.io/integrations/netatmo/ ### Diagnostics information _No response_ ### Example YAML snippet ```yaml ``` ### Anything in the logs that might be useful for us? ```txt 2025-09-14 23:15:59.725 ERROR (MainThread) [homeassistant.components.netatmo] Error during webhook registration - Webhook registration timed out ``` ### Additional information _No response_

issues.title: Add area labels to Prometheus metrics
issues.body:
<!--
  You are amazing! Thanks for contributing to our project!
  Please, DO NOT DELETE ANY TEXT from this template! (unless instructed).
-->

## Proposed change
<!--
  Describe the big picture of your changes here to communicate to the
  maintainers why we should accept this pull request. If it fixes a bug
  or resolves a feature request, be sure to link to that issue in the
  additional information section.
-->
Adding area-related labels to the exported Prometheus metrics.
More specifically: `area_id`, `area_name` and `area_norm_name` (from `area.normalized_name`)


Inspired by my own need, and the following requests:
- https://community.home-assistant.io/t/area-property-in-prometheus-metrics/325476
- https://community.home-assistant.io/t/add-support-to-set-custom-labels-for-prometheus/163966
- https://community.home-assistant.io/t/areas-in-prometheus/212243/2

It is my first contribution to Homeassistant, and long time since I wrote Python, so suggestions/improvements welcome!

I don't think this PR is ready to be merged as-is. I'd particularly like a review on my use of any `async` methods, the way I plug in the various registries to `PrometheusMetrics`, and then the way I use them to look up the entity's device and area.

I'd also like to add the `device_id` as a label, and perhaps also the `zone`.

issues.title: Unable to set Intensive Zone on Bosch Dishwasher
issues.body:
### The problem

I have an automation to select my desired program on my Bosch Dishwasher using the Home Connect integration. Part of this automation includes setting the Intensive Zone setting.

When I try and set this as part of the automation (or by toggling the switch on the Device), I get the following error:

Error setting the option for the program: Dishcare.Dishwasher.Option.IntensivZone currently not available or writable (SDK.Error.InvalidOptionState)

Intensive Zone is supported by my dishwasher, I’m able to set it just fine using the Home Connect App on my phone.

Any ideas what the problem could be and if it can be fixed?

### What version of Home Assistant Core has the issue?

core-2025.9.3

### What was the last working version of Home Assistant Core?

_No response_

### What type of installation are you running?

Home Assistant OS

### Integration causing the issue

Home Connect

### Link to integration documentation on our website

https://www.home-assistant.io/integrations/home_connect/

### Diagnostics information

_No response_

### Example YAML snippet

```yaml
: Dishwasher Door Closed Notification (Start Dishwasher)
description: ""
triggers:
  - entity_id:
      - sensor.bosch_dishwasher_door
    from: open
    to: closed
    trigger: state
conditions:
  - condition: time
    after: "08:00:00"
    before: "23:59:59"
actions:
  - data:
      title: Dishwasher
      message: The door was just closed. Start a program?
      data:
        actions:
          - action: start
            title: Start (70 Intensive + Intensive Zone)
          - action: cancel
            title: Cancel
    action: notify.mobile_app_adams_iphone_16_pro
  - wait_for_trigger:
      - event_type: ios.notification_action_fired
        event_data:
          actionName: start
        trigger: event
    timeout: "00:05:00"
    continue_on_timeout: false
  - if:
      - condition: device
        type: is_off
        device_id: 8c14f525e9a147211b391039cba6aed2
        entity_id: a2ce2d5fe23f2fa3fe3fc4d59a4bcab0
        domain: switch
    then:
      - type: turn_on
        device_id: 8c14f525e9a147211b391039cba6aed2
        entity_id: a2ce2d5fe23f2fa3fe3fc4d59a4bcab0
        domain: switch
  - delay:
      hours: 0
      minutes: 0
      seconds: 5
      milliseconds: 0
  - type: turn_on
    device_id: 8c14f525e9a147211b391039cba6aed2
    entity_id: 8fdc852a7934584d3d00c5bf1fa7c4e7
    domain: switch
  - choose:
      - conditions:
          - condition: template
            value_template: "{{ wait.trigger.event.data.actionName == 'start' }}"
        sequence:
          - device_id: 8c14f525e9a147211b391039cba6aed2
            domain: select
            entity_id: 0801905dbf85ad75a85a838a2ebe81b1
            type: select_option
            option: dishcare_dishwasher_program_intensiv_70
mode: restart
```

### Anything in the logs that might be useful for us?

```txt
In the YAML, it’s the switch just after the 5 second delay that is the Intensive Zone setting.
```

### Additional information

_No response_

I have 3 brel screens on a brel hub-03.

The debug log shows that 3 multicast packages are received in close succession, all three from one device.

issues.title: Permit long ping durations
issues.body:
## Proposed change

Currently, if a user sets up ping such that the polling interval and ping count takes longer than 10 seconds, the logs fill with warnings about the binary_sensor not updating in a reasonable time frame.

This change waits for the ping and if it doesn't complete in this time, returns from the async task, allowing the ping to continue in the background (so a future update will receive the ping result that's being waited on)

Recreated #143616 (unable to reopen / comment on that PR)

## Type of change

  What type of change does your PR introduce to Home Assistant?

issues.title: Update authorization server to prefer absolute urls
issues.body:
<!--

## Proposed change
<!--
  Describe the big picture of your changes here to communicate to the
  maintainers why we should accept this pull request. If it fixes a bug
  or resolves a feature request, be sure to link to that issue in the
  additional information section.
-->
Update authorization server to prefer absolute urls. This is intended to fix MCP and ChatGPT.

This prefers the url for the current request, and goes back to old behavior if we cannot match the current request URL to a configured url.

issues.title: Add Shelly removal condition for virtual components
issues.body: ## Proposed change Related to https://github.com/home-assistant/core/pull/152195 Shelly virtual components have different view modes, (e.g., a number component can be slider, field or label). For each mode we create a different HA entity (e.g., number as field creates a sensor entity, as slider a number entity) There was a bug that if the mode is incorrect we first create the entity and than remove it when cleaning up orphaned entities (entities that no longer exists on the device). To test this without cleanup, a fixture to disable cleanup for the relevant tests is introduced (`disable_async_remove_shelly_rpc_entities`) I run all the relevant tests with this fixture to first make sure they fail: Examples from the `switch` and `sensor` platforms: After that added a new method that uses the entity removal condition to make sure entities are not created Tested on Gen3 device with all types of supported virtual components and view modes ## Type of change - [ ] Dependency upgrade - [x] Bugfix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue) - [ ] New integration (thank you!) - [ ] New feature (which adds functionality to an existing integration) - [ ] Deprecation (breaking change to happen in the future) - [ ] Breaking change (fix/feature causing existing functionality to break) - [ ] Code quality improvements to existing code or addition of tests ## Additional information - This PR fixes or closes issue: fixes # - This PR is related to issue: - Link to documentation pull request: - Link to developer documentation pull request: - Link to frontend pull request: ## Checklist - [x] The code change is tested and works locally. - [x] Local tests pass. **Your PR cannot be merged unless tests pass** - [x] There is no commented out code in this PR. - [x] I have followed the [development checklist][dev-checklist] - [x] I have followed the [perfect PR recommendations][perfect-pr] - [x] The code has been formatted using Ruff (`ruff format homeassistant tests`) - [x] Tests have been added to verify that the new code works. issues.title: Sonos media_playlist attribute missing
issues.body:
### The problem

The media_playlist attribute is missing for Sonos devices, when (Spotify) playlists are triggered by Home Assistant. When the same playlists are started by the Sonos App, the media_playlist attribute is filled correctly.



### What version of Home Assistant Core has the issue?

core-2025.8.3

### What was the last working version of Home Assistant Core?

_No response_

### What type of installation are you running?

Home Assistant OS

### Integration causing the issue

Sonos

### Link to integration documentation on our website

https://www.home-assistant.io/integrations/sonos/

### Diagnostics information

_No response_

### Example YAML snippet

```yaml

```

### Anything in the logs that might be useful for us?

```txt

```

### Additional information

The rootcause is, that the SoCo Library DIDL-Lite metadata template is missing dc:title and parentID.
I implemented a workaround or potential solution in this branch:
https://github.com/SoCo/SoCo/compare/master...KarstenBade:SoCo:playlist_fix?diff=split&w
In this Branch the SoCo Lib takes the playlist title by kwargs.get("extra", {}).get("playlist_title", "") and sends the correct DIDL-Lite metadata. The Sonos Integration also needed a small patch to hand over the kwargs.

I would like to develop the official bugfix / feature enhancement myself, but wanted to discuss a clean architecture first. Therefor I decided to create this ticket for an alignment of the cleanest possible solution.

How are your thoughts? Is kwargs the correct place to hand over the playlist title?

issues.title: Android TV Remote: Assertion error on unique_id with STRONG Leap S3 Pro
issues.body:
### The problem

After pairing my STRONG Leap S3 Pro, the entities are not created. In the logs I've found an `AssertionError` on `unique_id` (see logs below).

I've added the config entry as assertion error message for better comprehension.

The STB has two network interfaces, thus not even the MAC serves as a unique criterion for an identifier, thus it is not included in the certificate used by `androidtvremote2`: https://github.com/tronikos/androidtvremote2/discussions/31

I don't know whether the Android TV Remote protocol allows reading e.g. the serial number. I couldn't find a way to determine another unique identifier in spec with the developer docs: https://developers.home-assistant.io/docs/entity_registry_index#unique-id-requirements (I would've used the hostname).

Please let me know if I can assist you with further details. If you tell me which identifier is usable, I'd also attempt raising a PR.

### What version of Home Assistant Core has the issue?

core-2025.9.3

### What was the last working version of Home Assistant Core?

_No response_

### What type of installation are you running?

Home Assistant Container

### Integration causing the issue

Android TV Remote

### Link to integration documentation on our website

https://www.home-assistant.io/integrations/androidtv_remote/

[config_entry-androidtv_remote-01K543YHE2K1XHBFTJ1FZ5R6WA.json](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/22320495/config_entry-androidtv_remote-01K543YHE2K1XHBFTJ1FZ5R6WA.json)

issues.title: Fix browse by language in radio browser
issues.body:
<!--
  You are amazing! Thanks for contributing to our project!
  Please, DO NOT DELETE ANY TEXT from this template! (unless instructed).
-->
## Proposed change

Browsing radio browser by language does not work correctly.

The radio browser api only supports search by language _name_, not by language code. 

The only reason we have any results at all is there is a second bug, by which when searching for language code, we also concatenate the same search by _country_ code in the results. 

So every time we search by language, we're really returning the results for that language code reinterpreted as a country code, if it exists, else we just get nothing. 



## Type of change
<!--
  What type of change does your PR introduce to Home Assistant?
  NOTE: Please, check only 1! box!

issues.title: Tuya smart socket voltage and wattage values multiplied by 10 in HA
issues.body:
### The problem

I've got a smart socket connected through Tuya and since like 2 days ago the voltage and wattage values that it provides have been multiplied by 10. (e.g.: instead of 1.6W it shows 16W in HA) Interestingly, the amperage value is correct from the same socket in HA.

The app shows the correct values, it's only the HA integration that is broken. 

I've tried removing and re-adding the integration, but that didn't help. 

I also got a few temperature and humidity sensors through Tuya, those seem unaffected by this.

### What version of Home Assistant Core has the issue?

core-2025.9.1

### What was the last working version of Home Assistant Core?

_No response_
