prs.title: Bump habluetooth to 5.6.4
prs.body:
## Proposed change
<!--
  Describe the big picture of your changes here to communicate to the
  maintainers why we should accept this pull request. If it fixes a bug
  or resolves a feature request, be sure to link to that issue in the
  additional information section.
-->

This PR fixes the high CPU usage issue (100% CPU) in Home Assistant Core 2025.9.2 by updating habluetooth to v5.6.4, which includes a workaround for a kernel bug in Bluetooth management sockets.

### Root Cause
The high CPU usage was caused by a kernel bug where `sendto()` on Bluetooth management sockets returns 0 instead of the number of bytes sent on some systems. When asyncio sees 0, it incorrectly interprets this as "nothing sent" and retries infinitely, causing 100% CPU usage.

### The Fix
habluetooth v5.6.4 includes a workaround that:
- Bypasses asyncio's transport layer for Bluetooth management sockets
- Writes directly to the socket
- Treats return value of 0 as success (which it actually is)

This prevents the infinite retry loop while maintaining full Bluetooth functionality.

Additional details https://github.com/Bluetooth-Devices/habluetooth/pull/303

**Changelog**: https://github.com/Bluetooth-Devices/habluetooth/compare/v5.6.2...v5.6.4

**Fixes** #152204

prs.title: Isolate existing schema, to allow for new schema in modbus.
prs.body:
<!--
  You are amazing! Thanks for contributing to our project!
  Please, DO NOT DELETE ANY TEXT from this template! (unless instructed).
-->
## Breaking change
<!--
  If your PR contains a breaking change for existing users, it is important
  to tell them what breaks, how to make it work again and why we did this.

  write it towards our users, not us.

<!--
  Describe the big picture of your changes here to communicate to the
  maintainers why we should accept this pull request. If it fixes a bug
  or resolves a feature request, be sure to link to that issue in the
  additional information section.
-->
The existing schema together with validators have been isolated in a single py file. This PR only contains this move, in order to secure that there are no schema changes affecting existing configurations.

This allows for the new schema (connections -> devices -> entities), to be added cleanly, with the possibility of automatic conversion from old to new schema.

This forms part of the steps needed to allow modbus to be configured via the UI.

prs.title: Fix high CPU usage caused by go2rtc inheriting file descriptors
prs.body:
## Proposed change

This PR addresses the high CPU usage issue in 2025.9.2 (#152204) where Home Assistant consumes 100% CPU for some users. Based on diagnostic data from affected users (strace output and file descriptor analysis), the issue appears to be caused by an infinite communication loop between go2rtc and the Bluetooth management socket.

**Note: This fix is based on analysis of user-provided logs and diagnostic data. The issue could not be reproduced locally across 9 test systems.**

### Root Cause Analysis
Based on user strace data, when go2rtc subprocess was spawned with `close_fds=False`, it inherited all open file descriptors from the parent Python process, including the Bluetooth management socket (FD 49). This appears to cause:

1. habluetooth (5.3.1+) sends Bluetooth management protocol messages on FD 49
2. go2rtc (written in Go) also receives these messages on the shared FD 49
3. go2rtc doesn't understand Bluetooth protocol and responds with unexpected data
4. This creates an infinite ping-pong loop with millions of `sendmsg`/`recvfrom` calls per minute
5. Result: 100% CPU usage

### The Fix
Set `close_fds=True` when spawning go2rtc to prevent it from inheriting file descriptors it shouldn't have access to.

### Diagnostic Data from Affected Users
Strace output provided by users experiencing the issue shows a tight loop:
```
recvfrom(49, "\2\0\0\0\3\0\25\0\21", 262144, 0, NULL, NULL) = 9
sendmsg(49, {msg_name=NULL, msg_namelen=0, msg_iov=[{iov_base="\25\0\0\0\0\0", iov_len=6}], msg_iovlen=1, msg_controllen=0, msg_flags=0}, 0) = 0
```

Where:
- `\2\0` = `MGMT_EV_CMD_STATUS` (Bluetooth management event)
- `\25\0` = `MGMT_OP_GET_CONNECTIONS` (Bluetooth management operation)

lsof shows FD 49 is shared between Python and go2rtc:
```
67      /usr/local/bin/python3.13       49      socket:[17416]
106     /bin/go2rtc                      49      socket:[17416]
```

## Type of change

- [x] Bugfix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)

## Additional information

- This PR fixes or closes issue: fixes #152204
- This PR is related to issue:
- Link to documentation pull request:
- Link to developer documentation pull request:
- Link to frontend pull request:

### Why this only affects some users
The issue only occurs when:
1. Bluetooth is enabled (creates management socket)
2. habluetooth 5.3.1+ is present (actively uses the socket for capability detection)
3. go2rtc is running (camera/streaming features enabled)
4. The combination creates the FD inheritance conflict

### Testing Needed
- Unable to reproduce the issue locally to verify the fix
- Need confirmation from affected users that this resolves the high CPU usage
- Setting `close_fds=True` is the standard best practice to prevent subprocess FD inheritance issues

## Checklist

- [x] The code change is tested and works locally.
- [x] Local tests pass. **Your PR cannot be merged unless tests pass**

prs.title: Fix HomeKit Controller overwhelming resource-limited devices by batching characteristic polling
prs.body:
## Proposed change
This PR fixes an issue where HomeKit Controller can overwhelm HomeKit accessories with limited resources (like Honeywell T9/T10 thermostats) by requesting too many characteristics in a single request, resulting in "Out of resources" errors.

The fix implements batching of characteristic requests to ensure we never request more than 49 characteristics at once. While most HomeKit accessories can handle large requests, some devices have limited resources and cannot process many characteristics simultaneously. Since we don't know each device's specific limit, we use a conservative batch size that works with all devices, including those with limited resources.

Additionally, this PR fixes the polling order during startup to ensure devices are created with fresh values instead of stale cached data. The `/accessories` endpoint may return cached values from the accessory's perspective (e.g., Ecobee thermostats reporting 100°C after restart), so we explicitly poll characteristics before processing the entity map.

## Type of change

- [x] Bugfix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)

prs.title: Fix Lutron Caseta shade stuttering and improve stop functionality
prs.body:
## Proposed change
<!--
  Describe the big picture of your changes here to communicate to the
  maintainers why we should accept this pull request. If it fixes a bug
  or resolves a feature request, be sure to link to that issue in the
  additional information section.
-->

This PR fixes the long-standing Lutron Caseta shade stuttering issue and ensures stop commands work reliably.

### Problem 1: Shade Stuttering
Shades exhibit a "nudge, pause, then continue" stuttering behavior when using open/close commands. This has been reported in multiple issues over the years.

**Solution**: Use `set_value(100)` for open and `set_value(0)` for close instead of `raise_cover`/`lower_cover`. This provides smooth, stutter-free operation.

### Problem 2: Stop Command Reliability  
When we changed open/close to use `set_value` (to fix stuttering), we lost the implicit directional context that `raise_cover`/`lower_cover` provided. However, the Lutron LEAP protocol requires a directional command before stop will work.

**The causal chain**:
1. We changed to `set_value(100)`/`set_value(0)` to fix stuttering
2. This removed the directional commands from open/close operations
3. But LEAP protocol requires sending a matching directional command (raise or lower) before stop
4. So we now must track movement direction to know which command to send

**How direction tracking works**:
- Monitor position changes from the bridge to detect movement direction
- Track whether shade is moving up, down, or stopped
- When stop is called, send the appropriate directional command first:
  - If moving up: send `raise_cover` then `stop_cover`
  - If moving down: send `lower_cover` then `stop_cover`

**Why tracking matters**:
In practice, sending either `raise_cover` or `lower_cover` before stop works - the commands execute so quickly on the hardwired Ethernet bridge that it's not noticeable. However, tracking the correct direction is about:
- **Correctness**: Sending the right command per the protocol
- **Network latency**: If Home Assistant is on WiFi or has other network delays, sending the wrong directional command could cause a visible "bump" in the wrong direction before stopping
- **Future compatibility**: Ensuring we follow the protocol correctly

**Important**: The movement direction tracking exists ONLY because we changed to `set_value` for open/close. It's the price we pay for smooth, stutter-free operation while maintaining stop functionality with Lutron's protocol requirements.

### Why this belongs in Home Assistant (not pylutron_caseta)
The pylutron_caseta library is intentionally a thin wrapper around LEAP protocol commands. This issue is specifically about mapping Home Assistant's entity model (open/close/stop) to Lutron's protocol requirements. The library correctly exposes the raw commands - it's Home Assistant's responsibility to use them appropriately for a good user experience.

**The mapping problem**:
- Home Assistant expects: `open_cover()`, `close_cover()`, `stop_cover()`
- Lutron provides: `set_value()`, `raise_cover()`, `lower_cover()`, `stop_cover()`
- The stuttering fix changes how we map open/close
- This creates a side effect for stop that needs HA-level state tracking

### History and context
This stuttering issue has been reported for years (#78971, #98365, #151462) with multiple failed attempts to fix it. After extensive testing and analysis, this solution finally addresses both the stuttering and maintains reliable stop functionality.

### Implementation details:
- Track actual position changes from the bridge (handles manual control via physical buttons/Lutron app)
- Add intermediate callback (`_handle_bridge_update`) to hook state updates without overriding core HA methods
- Fallback heuristics when direction is unknown (position-based inference)

## Type of change

prs.title: Rejseplan api 2 0
prs.body:
## Breaking change
The integration now requires an API key from rejseplanen. You can apply for an API key on https://labs.rejseplanen.dk/hc/en-us/articles/21553113674909-Adgang-til-data-fra-Labs. Configuration have moved from yaml to config flow.


## Proposed change
Replaced the pypi module responsible for communicating with the closed REST api and implemented my own pypi module that handles communication with the new v2,0 API from Rejseplanen A/S. As the old API have been closed since Dec 2024 I do not see a problem in the reuse of the on integration in core, as most have disabled or removed the old config. 
The function of this is and replacement is requested by community in Denmark, see https://github.com/home-assistant/core/issues/133420#issuecomment-3286717427. I have worked with developers from Rejseplanen.dk instead of the various workaround solutions out there.

## Type of change
- [ ] Dependency upgrade
- [ ] Bugfix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
- [ ] New integration (thank you!)
- [x] New feature (which adds functionality to an existing integration)
- [ ] Deprecation (breaking change to happen in the future)
- [x] Breaking change (fix/feature causing existing functionality to break)
- [ ] Code quality improvements to existing code or addition of tests

## Additional information
This is a major overhaul. I could not break it into smaller bits as the functionality would not be maintained anyway. And during discussions with @joostlek in my previous PR, I needed to implement both Configflow and test as legacy was not being merged.

prs.title: Fix Shelly orphaned entity removal logic to handle sub-devices
prs.body:
<!--
  You are amazing! Thanks for contributing to our project!
  Please, DO NOT DELETE ANY TEXT from this template! (unless instructed).
-->
## Proposed change
<!--
  Describe the big picture of your changes here to communicate to the
  maintainers why we should accept this pull request. If it fixes a bug
  or resolves a feature request, be sure to link to that issue in the
  additional information section.
-->
Shelly integration supports virtual components and devices that has multiple profiles which creates different entities, the logic to remove orphaned entities (entities from an older configuration that doesn't match the current device configuration) was only referring to the main device and not to sub devices. This PR fixes it. Two tests adjusted to validate that entities on sub devices are removed.

Note: During this PR I noticed two related issues which will be fixed in future PRs:
- There are cases that we first create an entity that should not be created and than clean it up, entity should not be created at first place so that we don't need to remove it later.
- Sub devices needs to be removed if the current configuration leave them without any entities.

prs.title: Add service for logging Python audit events to profiler integration
prs.body:
## Proposed change

Python has "auditing" API which provides a way to track certain actions which are executed in runtime. This can be useful for instance when user wants to track what integrations are making outbound network connection or accessing files on the filesystem, which may be needed also to identify sources of resource leaks.

This PR adds services for configuring what audit events should be logged, with optional filtering and full traceback capture.

The Audit API was defined by PEP 578 and is available in the standard library since Python 3.8: https://peps.python.org/pep-0578

List of events which can be audited:
https://docs.python.org/3/library/audit_events.html


## Type of change
<!--
  What type of change does your PR introduce to Home Assistant?

prs.title: Add runtime-changeable exclusion of entities from recording
prs.body:
<!--
  You are amazing! Thanks for contributing to our project!
  Please, DO NOT DELETE ANY TEXT from this template! (unless instructed).
-->
## Proposed change
<!--
  Describe the big picture of your changes here to communicate to the
  maintainers why we should accept this pull request. If it fixes a bug
  or resolves a feature request, be sure to link to that issue in the
  additional information section.
-->
Add runtime-changeable exclusion of entities from recording:
- Entities in the entity registry stores the recorder setting as entity options under the `recorder` domain
- Settings for entities which are not in the entity registry are stored in a separate store
- Recorder entity filter is imported once, after that the source of truth is entity registry / store
- WS commands for reading and writing entity recording flag
- TODO: Allow integrations to mark entities which should be excluded from recording
- TODO: Tell the user to remove entity filter from yaml
- TODO: Deprecate recorder entity filter in yaml
- TODO: Add tests

prs.title: Adjust sensor group behavior
prs.body:
<!--
  You are amazing! Thanks for contributing to our project!
  Please, DO NOT DELETE ANY TEXT from this template! (unless instructed).
-->
## Breaking change
The behavior of sensor groups has changed:
- TO BE SUMMARIZED

## Proposed change
<!--
  Describe the big picture of your changes here to communicate to the
  maintainers why we should accept this pull request. If it fixes a bug
  or resolves a feature request, be sure to link to that issue in the
  additional information section.
-->
Adjust sensor group behavior:
- Change the condition for when a sensor group is unavailable
- Don't allow missing states when `ignore_non_numeric` is `False`

This is meant as an alternative to https://github.com/home-assistant/core/pull/145001

TODO: Add tests

### Numerical group behavior **without** this PR

#### Sensor, number, and input_number groups

- The group state is combined / calculated based on `type` selected to determine the minimum, maximum, latest (last), mean, median, range, product, standard deviation, or sum of the collected states.
- Members can be any `sensor`, `number` or `input_number` holding numeric states.
- States which are missing from the state machine do not make the state `unavailable` or `unknown`.
- The group state is `unavailable` if no group member has a numeric state.
- The configuration variable `ignore_non_numeric` controls the behavior of the group when the group is not `unavailable`:
   - When set to `false` (the default), the group state is calculated as follows:
      - if all members have a numeric state: calculated according to the `type` 
      - otherwise: set to `unknown` 
   - When set to `true`, the group state is calculated as follows:
      - if at least one member has a numeric state: calculated according to the `type`
      - otherwise:  and set to `unknown`

### Numerical group behavior **with** this PR

#### Sensor, number, and input_number groups

- The group state is combined / calculated based on `type` selected to determine the minimum, maximum, latest (last), mean, median, range, product, standard deviation, or sum of the collected states.
- Members can be any `sensor`, `number` or `input_number` holding numeric states.
- The group state is `unavailable` if all group members are either `unavailable` or missing
- The configuration variable `ignore_non_numeric` controls the behavior of the group when the group is not `unavailable`:
   - When set to `false` (the default), the group state is calculated as follows:
      - if all members are in the state machine and have a numeric state: calculated according to the `type` 
      - otherwise: set to `unknown` 
   - When set to `true`, the group state is calculated as follows:
      - if at least one member has a numeric state: calculated according to the `type`
      - otherwise:  and set to `unknown`

## Type of change

Add config_flow to modbus, this is currently NOT to make configuration but create a config entry, which allows devices to be created (a long time user wish).

The config_flow will slowly be extended to include devices/sub-devices and be the fundament for a try to configure via the UI.

prs.title: Fix creation of invalid Unicast Bindings
prs.body:
Seen on macOS somehow clang did not init all fields of the binding to zero when creating an object via `DDF_Binding result = {}`. The `u64 dstExtAddress` wasn't initialized only the `u16 dstGroup` in the union. The ext address was some random stuff from memory.

The fix ensures all fields including `dstExtAdress` are zero. And the unicast destination address is filled with the actual coordinator mac address.

Note: Invalid bindings from previous releases are automatically cleaned up and repaired by the `Device` state machine.

prs.title: Fix Ledvance PLUG (COMPACT) EU EM T binding table query loop
prs.body:
For some reason the plug reports extra unicast bindings in the binding table. The `Device` state machine tries to clean them up via ZDP Unbind but while the device responds with status Success the bindings aren't removed.

This loops forever. Therefore the PR just says don't use the binding table. Note: creation of the DDF bindings is still done.

prs.title: Add actor model to query device resources and resource items as VFS
prs.body: The PR adds an actor model (AM) entry point which lets the GUI and other actors query resources in the plugin by sending small *asynchronous* messages. For now this supports read-only queries against resources and sub-resources of the `Device` class. There is a virtual file system (VFS) protocol layered on top of AM messages to read virtual directories and files. In the upcoming deCONZ version the VFS is visualized in a debug widget which can be accessed via menu: *Help → Data view* **Note:** The widget doesn't know anything about devices or resource items, it only shows directories and entries. The PR generically presents a path like `/devices/00:15:8d:00:01:a2:4a:ff/subdevices/00:15:8d:00:01:a2:4a:ff-01-0406/state/presence` as tree. Items like `state/presence` represent a directory (state) with an entry (presence). **Implementation details:** The actor model in deCONZ is a new way to let various components or plugins send messages to each other without tight coupling via C/C++ APIs. For example the REST plugin can talk with the OTA plugin, GUI or GCFFlasher. Currently this is internal but will be extended to be reachable via encrypted WebSockets. There is no `get_all`, the whole VFS works just like a file system API each directory and entry is queried as a single request. Directories may require multiple requests if the content doesn't fit in a single response as the actor model used rather small message sizes of max. 4k - 64k. The VFS updates its state automatically, similar to ZCL attribute reporting values that are changed emit a notification to all subscribers. ----- This is the first step to get the REST plugin data represented in the GUI. Next goal is to also visualize some of the data within Node GUI, e.g. a light showing its on/off state or sensors their values. Ideally this can be customized by the user by just drag and drop values from the Data view onto the node in the GUI.

prs.title: DDF for Namron 8 button switch (4512772, 4512773)
prs.body:
This adds support for the Namron 8 button switches [4512772](https://efobasen.efo.no/produkter/vis/4512772) and [4512773](https://efobasen.efo.no/produkter/vis/4512773)

I have successfully tested that this works for `4512773`.

The reason for the new block in `button_maps.json` is that:

The **dim up** buttons (1,3,4,5) send these commands:
When holding down: MOVE_WITH_ON_OFF (0x05)
When releasing: STOP_WITH_ON_OFF (0x07)

The **dim down** buttons (2,4,6,8) send these commands:
When holding down: MOVE (0x01)
When releasing: STOP (0x03)

What I don't know is if `4512772` (or other devices) also need to use the new block in `button_maps.json` or not.
(I only own the 4512773)

The capitalization of the manufacturer should be all-caps for both `4512772` and `4512773`, but not for the other Namron devices.

This is a fork of #7615 . See the discussion in that PR for more details.

The device now correctly reports its state when toggled via software or manually.  Tested with deCONZ version 2.30.2 — works reliably after initial pairing.

prs.title: Fix strings without data being null, return empty string instead
prs.body: This fixes the remaining cases where strings could be `null` in my setup only `swversion` and `productid` where affected, since the others are handled by previous PRs.

prs.title: Fix don't expose null values from Device for sensors and lights
prs.body: For legacy devices this affected items like `cap/sleeper`.

prs.title: Fix missing lights and groups Websocket deleted events
prs.body: Pretty sure they were there in the past?!

prs.title: Fix don't expose Configuration tool (coordinator) lastannounced
prs.body:
The item doesn't make sense for coordinator.
Also update the NWK address for legacy devices (incl. coordinator) if needed.

prs.title: Fix legacy sensors lastseen or lastannounced = null
prs.body: If we can't derive a timestamp from devices table try using `state/lastupdated` instead.

prs.title: Improve ZGP device representation
prs.body:
- Device class introduce `DEV_ZgpStateHandler()` which hides `attr/nwkaddress` and sets `capabilitiess/sleeper` to `true`.
- Remove `attr/lastannounced` because ZGP devices don't do this and hence attribute was always `null`.
- Always set `attr/lastseen` when ZGP button event is received.
- When pairing a ZGP device make sure its parent is set to respective Device.

prs.title: Fix don't expose `ddf_hash` and `ddf_policy` for lights and sensors
prs.body: These are only part of `/devices` endpoint. Also removes another attribute which can be `null` for lights and sensors.

prs.title: Fix don't expose internal attr/zonetype to REST-API
prs.body:
The item is usefull internally to setup the IAS cluster. It is automatically added by the Device class if a IAS cluster is detected. Since `sensorToMap()` also exports Device items it should be non public.

Also prevents showing this attribute as `null` if no data is available for it.

prs.title: Fix attr/lastannounced and attr/lastseen sometimes being null
prs.body:
PR https://github.com/dresden-elektronik/deconz-rest-plugin/pull/8213 already fixes many instances when the problem occurs, but there are valid timestamps for DDF devices in 'resource_items' table.

However that's not always the case. To cleanup old invalid null entries, this PR takes the device creation time as initial value.

prs.title: Make Device creation time available
prs.body:
The database already contains the timestamp when a device was created for DDF and legacy devices. This PR loads the timestamp from the database when the Device instance is created.

Will be used in a further PR.

prs.title: Fix ResourceItem set (UTC) timestamps from string
prs.body:
This is mainly called when loading items from database. The previous implementation didn't handle non UTC timestamps well. Causing items like `attr/lastannounced` to be `null`.

Instead of `QDateTime` the PR uses the `U_TimeFromISO8601()` function of the library which parses all formats. Some items have missing Z in their UTC timestamp for historical reasons. We can't change the database format for these to stay backward compatible, but append the Z for parsing correctly.

prs.title: Fix missing default/init values for DDF items

Without these the REST-API would return `null` for items that don't have a value yet. For strings that's ok but numbers and bool values may cause trouble for API clients.

https://forum.phoscon.de/t/decon-v2-29-5-hue-essential-regression/6312/6

prs.title: Fix Ikea scenes with on/off going wild
prs.body:
Issue: https://github.com/dresden-elektronik/deconz-rest-plugin/issues/8187

When a scene with `on=false` is recalled, we send a *Off With Effect Command* to Ikea lights since they otherwise won't turn off physically. There is also a `StateChange` added to ensure this works, which is usually a good thing.

However if a scene is then called with `on=true`, the `StateChange` *might* still be alive and turn the light off again. This can be seen in the issue.

The PR clears the `state/on` `StateChange` for Ikea lights when a scene is recalled preventing old state to be applied on a newer one.

prs.title: Reduce Websocket event pressure due attr/lastseen
prs.body:
This PR changes Websocket events caused by `attr/lastseen` updates to only contain that value but not the full `attr` object.

This reduces traffic load on Websockets and also prevents the plugin to cycle through all ResourceItems and build the whole response.

The `attr/lastseen` might be emitted at most once per minute per device, which in a larger network causes quite some traffic.

prs.title: DDF clone for temperature and humidity sensor (_TZE200_vs0skpuc)
prs.body: new manufactuername _TZE200_vs0skpuc added

prs.title: Fix light Websocket events
prs.body:
Similar treatment as in https://github.com/dresden-elektronik/deconz-rest-plugin/pull/8189

This PR will only emit Websocket events for the objects `attr`, `state`, `config`, etc. if the internal event for it originates such an item. It prevents extra events like `config` object when just an `attr` object should be send via Websocket.

Clearing the push flags happens now after `lightToMap()` is called to clear only items which fit the internal event suffix. I prefer to let `lightToMap()` to not have this logic. The check group event is also emitted outside `lightToMap()` now.

prs.title: Fix ghost events for sensors
prs.body:
After the refactor of `sensorToMap()` when an event arrived in `handleSensorEvent()` not only the respective parent object like `attr/`, `state/`, `config/`, etc. was emitted on Websocket but sometimes other event objects too.

The PR prevents this to filter out any item that doesn't match the events item suffix.

Related forum posts:

https://forum.phoscon.de/t/ghost-button-events-with-deconz-2-29-5-and-aqara-smart-button/6300/14

https://forum.phoscon.de/t/lumi-vibration-aq1-sensor-with-phantom-triggers-since-deconz-2-29-5/6305/6

The `lumi.remote.b1acn01` only supports double press that's why 1005 isn't exposed.

prs.title: Fix CMake FetchContent_Populate() deprecated warnings
prs.body: FetchContent_Populate() with single argument is deprecated.

prs.title: Hide non public shared library symbols on Unix
prs.body: The plugin shared library `(.dll|.so|.dylib)` shouldn't export hundreds of symbols. On Windows the default is to hide them, Unix needs to specify this explicitly.

Default 0. Attr: 0x0101, INT16 (id:0x29), Humidity offset, in 0.01% steps, range: -32767 (-327.67%)..32767(+327.67%). Default 0. Attr: 0x0102, INT16 (id:0x29), Comfort temperature minimum, in 0.01° steps, range -32767..+32767 (-327.67° ..+327.67°). Default 2000 (20.00°C). Attr: 0x0103, INT16 (id:0x29), Comfort temperature maximum, in 0.01° steps, range -32767..+32767 (-327.67° ..+327.67°). Default 2500 (25.00°C). Attr: 0x0104, UINT16 (id:0x21), Comfort humidity minimum, in 1% steps, range 0..9999 (0..99.99%). Default 4000 (40.00%). Attr: 0x0105, UINT16 (id:0x21), Comfort humidity maximum, in 1% steps, range 0..9999 (0..99.99%). Default 6000 (60.00%). Attr: 0x0106, ENUM8 (id:0x30), Turn off the display. 1 - Display Off. Default 0 - Display On. Attr: 0x0107, UINT8 (id:0x20), Measurement interval, range: 3..255 seconds. Default 10 seconds. ``` Attributes 0x0000 and 0x0002 can already be controlled.

prs.title: Temporary solution for _TZ3000_qeuvnohg
prs.body:
This PR aims to override the PR at https://github.com/dresden-elektronik/deconz-rest-plugin/pull/7012, to make these MAINS device(s) available, but also to mitigate the danger inherent to the MAINS type in that PR.

This is a temporary solution until Mains switches are handled better in Phoscon GUI.

Note that in above discussion it was argued, that security is the job for the API client. Since Phoscon GUI does not yet handle mains specifically, I suggest to merge this PR in the meantime, having:

- no `lights:state/on` property (disable switch)
- `"type": "$TYPE_SMART_PLUG"`, because it currently fits better with the Phoscon GUI.

The remarks by @BabaIsYou for the similar devices (`"_TZ3000_ky0fq4ho","_TZ3000_8bxrzyxz"`) are in this PR too, though untested by myself.

Please DEVs, review/change the timings to your likings. Thanks.

If this gets merged, then https://github.com/dresden-elektronik/deconz-rest-plugin/pull/7012 is not valid anymore.

cheers


![Tongou_TO-Q-SY1-JZT](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/34c60207-3e42-4749-b165-4b340a4409e4)

prs.title: Fix hot reload and events not emitted after joining a device
prs.body: Every item has a load counter, when get item is called it must be checked against the handle, not the global counter.

prs.title: Fix zombie entries when deleting a device
prs.body:
In some cases when a node wasn't loaded fully and is deleted entries in `nodes` and `sensors` tables could survive.

The PR ensures that these entries are deleted, and the device won't show up again until rejoining.

prs.title: Fix loading DDF devices from database which weren't fully setup
prs.body: Usually these were skipped and shown as only hex number nodes. If the node was reachable the Basic cluster attributes were queried, but if it is a Zombie the node remained a "hex node".

prs.title: Fix database not storing / fresh values of strings
prs.body: Not the best approach but right now it's better to have fresh timestamps on startup. Add various `item->clearNeedStore()` to items that were loaded from database too.

prs.title: Fix to prevent poll attributes after startup if value timestamp is fresh enough
prs.body:
E.g before this PR `SwBuildId` and similar attributes would be queried even if they already have been queried during the DDF `refreshInterval`.

This reduces traffic after startup.

prs.title: Fix loading Device reachable = true, set to false if older than 24h
prs.body:
The database can contain reachable = true entries but for older timestamps. Fix this on load to prevent early requests to these devices.

TODO: The core should also now about this to adapt Zombie state.

prs.title: Fix don't query binding table for routers with no DDF bindings
prs.body: Prevents more useless ZDP requests.

releases.body:
# Notes
- In the October release the new [Windfront frontend](https://www.zigbee2mqtt.io/guide/configuration/frontend.html#zigbee2mqtt-windfront) will become the default. Make sure to check it out and provide your feedback in https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee2mqtt/discussions/28442. In case you encounter bugs, submit a new issue [here](https://github.com/Nerivec/zigbee2mqtt-windfront/issues). This means that:
  - If you have no [specific frontend configured](https://www.zigbee2mqtt.io/guide/configuration/frontend.html#package-setting-details), Windfront will be used
  - It's still possible to use the legacy frontend, but note that it will not receive any new features
- Some URLs in the Windfront frontend have been changed, make sure to update your bookmarks in case you had them.
- Various changes have been made which can break external converters, especially Tuya devices will be affected. In case your external converter does not work anymore please [submit an issue](https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee2mqtt/issues).
- Due to the added support of ZCL non-values (values used to indicate "unavailable state", calibrating, etc.) if you see a device value not being updated when you usually did before (albeit to a weird value like -367.68°C), it could be the sensor of the device is temporarily unavailable.

# Improvements
- [#9892](https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee-herdsman-converters/issues/9892) Gledopto GL-S-006P: expose power on behaviour (@alxwtf)
- [#9888](https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee-herdsman-converters/issues/9888) Schneider Electric S520619: support cooling setpoint (@pcurt)
- [#9865](https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee-herdsman-converters/issues/9865) Bosch `BSP-FZ2` (Plug compact II): Support reset of energy meter and lower min value change on electricityMeter reporting (@DerDreschner)
- [#9869](https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee-herdsman-converters/issues/9869) Onokom: various improvements (@Ziracul)
- [#9849](https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee-herdsman-converters/issues/9849) Zemismart TB26-3: support more features (@bernardesarthur)
- [#838](https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee-OTA/issues/838) SONOFF SNZB-05P: support OTA (@Koenkk)
- [#9834](https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee-herdsman-converters/issues/9834) Shelly 2PM: support cover and switch mode (@jfmlima)
- [#9806](https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee-herdsman-converters/issues/9806) Soil Pro: support measurement mode selection (@SimplaHome)
- [#9816](https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee-herdsman-converters/issues/9816) WDE002386: add more features (@rettelx)
- [#9798](https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee-herdsman-converters/issues/9798) SONOFF SNZB-02P: add more features (@laity-w-sudo)
- [#9735](https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee-herdsman-converters/issues/9735) Add support for Inovelli's custom ledEffectComplete command (@rohankapoorcom)
- [#28165](https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee2mqtt/discussions/28165) Bosch BMCT-DZ: support OTA (@Koenkk)
- [#9736](https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee-herdsman-converters/issues/9736) Shelly 2PM: support tilt (@Kipjr)
- [#9730](https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee-herdsman-converters/issues/9730) Tuya TRV601 and TS0601_thermostat_1: support new options (@bernardesarthur)
- [#1459](https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee-herdsman/issues/1459) Autotype ZCL clusters (@Nerivec)
- [#9753](https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee-herdsman-converters/pull/9753) Sinope: support electrical measurements for some devices (@chdagenais)

# Fixes
- [#28202](https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee2mqtt/issues/28202) Always unlink `node_modules` symlinks on stop (@Nerivec)
- [#28192](https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee2mqtt/issues/28192) Home Assistant: set icon and state class for orientation sensors (@mik-laj)
- [#28329](https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee2mqtt/issues/28329) Home Assistant: use "occupancy" device_class for human presence sensors (@jspiros)
- [#28160](https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee2mqtt/issues/28160) Remove 60 MB (28%) of dev dependencies from Docker image (@krkk)
- [#28209](https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee2mqtt/issues/28209) Set minimum for some settings (@Nerivec)
- [#28257](https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee2mqtt/issues/28257) Support for new ZH typing (@Nerivec)
- [#27984](https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee2mqtt/issues/27984) Update to refactored zhc api and fix `onEvent(stop)` not being called when device is force removed (@Koenkk)
- [#28389](https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee2mqtt/issues/28389) Update zigbee2mqtt-windfront to 2.0.0 (@Nerivec)
- [#9896](https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee-herdsman-converters/issues/9896) Legrand ZLGP17/ZLGP18: fix missing up and down long press action (@chris-1243)
- [#9883](https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee-herdsman-converters/issues/9883) Clicksmart+ CMA30651: fix integration (@dodger421)
- [#9588](https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee-herdsman-converters/pull/9588) Tuya _TZE204_ltwbm23f: fix local temperature calibration step size (@Koenkk)
- [#9891](https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee-herdsman-converters/issues/9891) Tuya BLE-YL01: improve integration (@xvolte)
- [#9877](https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee-herdsman-converters/issues/9877) Sunricher SR-ZG9101SAC-HP-SWITCH-2CH: fix configure failing (@chris-1243)
- [#9870](https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee-herdsman-converters/issues/9870) Create inovelliMMWave modern extend to relocate mmWave commands and support future expansion (@rohankapoorcom)
- [#9852](https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee-herdsman-converters/issues/9852) Bosch `BMCT-SLZ`: various enhancements and fixes (@DerDreschner)
- [#9848](https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee-herdsman-converters/issues/9848) Correct vendor from GiEX to GIEX (@bernardesarthur)
- [#9835](https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee-herdsman-converters/issues/9835) Create custom modernExtend classes to use with Inovelli devices (@rohankapoorcom)
- [#9786](https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee-herdsman-converters/issues/9786) Tuya `_TZ3000_okaz9tjs`: fix configure failing (@Koenkk)

# Notes
- This is a hot-fix release that resolves startup failures for users with Conbee adapters running older firmware version (https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee2mqtt/issues/27864)

# Fixes
- [#27880](https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee2mqtt/issues/27880) Various Windfront frontend improvements  (@nerivec)
- [#1438](https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee-herdsman/issues/1438) DeCONZ: Handle unsupported status code for read parameter response (@manup)

# Notes - Based on the feedback in https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee2mqtt/discussions/27564 a lot of improvements have been done to new [Windfront frontend](https://www.zigbee2mqtt.io/guide/configuration/frontend.html#experimental-zigbee2mqtt-windfront). The improved version also adds support for the new health feature (thanks @Nerivec!).
- The [deCONZ](https://www.zigbee2mqtt.io/guide/adapters/deconz.html) driver has been completely refactored. It now supports backups and channel changing (thanks @manup!). # Features - [#27164](https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee2mqtt/issues/27164) New health extension & extras in `bridge/info` (@Nerivec) # Improvements - # Notes
- This release comes with a new frontend called *[zigbee2mqtt-windfront](https://github.com/Nerivec/zigbee2mqtt-windfront)* which is an improved version of the current frontend developed by @Nerivec. To enable this new frontend set the following in your `configuration.yaml`:
  ```yaml
  frontend:
    enabled: true
    package: zigbee2mqtt-windfront
  ```
  Feedback on this new frontend can be given in https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee2mqtt/discussions/27564
- For bare metal installations: support for NodeJS 18 has been dropped.

- [#27489](https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee2mqtt/issues/27489) WindFront new frontend support (@Nerivec)

# Notes
- A [development environment](https://github.com/Nerivec/z2m-external-converter-dev) for external converters is now available.
- This release brings improvements to the availability feature, this slightly changes the behaviour, see https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee2mqtt/pull/26811 for more details.

# Features
- [#26823](https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee2mqtt/issues/26823) Allow scheduling OTA on device request (@Nerivec)
- [#26811](https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee2mqtt/issues/26811) Availability improvements (@Nerivec)

# Improvements
- [#9224](https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee-herdsman-converters/issues/9224) Immax 07505L: add more features (@gmartin42)

# Notes
- This is a hot-fix release to fix various issues introduced in 2.2.0.
- For bare metal installations (not when using Docker or HA addon): it is recommended to update your NodeJS version to 22 (otherwise you might experience #26937)

# Fixes
- [#26947](https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee2mqtt/issues/26947) Fix issue with some settings when migrating from 1.x.x to 2.2.x (@Nerivec)
- [#26988](https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee2mqtt/issues/26988) Fix settings being overwriting when env var is set to a ref (@Koenkk)
- [#9116](https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee-herdsman-converters/issues/9116) Fixed pairing of Livolo TI0001 switches (@flaterichd)
- [#9115](https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee-herdsman-converters/pull/9115) Tuya ZY-M100-S_2: fix presence and illuminance (@jernau)
- [#9110](https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee-herdsman-converters/issues/9110) Configure reporting for various Sunricher devices (@niracler)
- [#26939](https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee2mqtt/issues/26939) Fix LiXee devices causing `mqtt disconnected due to malformed` (@Koenkk)
- [#9109](https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee-herdsman-converters/issues/9109) LiXee: fix `kwhPrecision is not defined` error (@Koenkk)
- [#9111](https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee-herdsman-converters/issues/9111) Tuya TS0002_limited: support countdown (@mrmaximas)
- [#9103](https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee-herdsman-converters/issues/9103) Fix GL-C-007-2ID not being detected correctly (@Xyaren)

# Frontend
- [7e72b00](https://github.com/nurikk/zigbee2mqtt-frontend/commit/7e72b00c55012e6d44d3e1856d34a667b9479928) Fix offline showing when availability is not enabled (@Koenkk)
- [403ffac](https://github.com/nurikk/zigbee2mqtt-frontend/commit/403ffacef7865873cdb755b95c91e1850a2b9443) Improve typing & icons (@Nerivec)


# New supported devices
This release adds support for 3 devices: 
- [#25053](https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee2mqtt/issues/25053) `ZG-101Z/D` Tuya Smart knob (@Koenkk)
- [#9107](https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee-herdsman-converters/issues/9107) `S4SW-001P8EU` Shelly 1PM Mini Gen 4 (@marce14-git)
- [#9107](https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee-herdsman-converters/issues/9107) `S4SW-001P16EU` Shelly 1PM Gen 4 (@marce14-git)

# Fixed device detections
- [#9113](https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee-herdsman-converters/issues/9113) Detect `_TZ3000_bmhwnl7s` as Lonsonho TS130F_dual (@dmarszk)
- [#26940](https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee2mqtt/issues/26940) Detect `_TZE284_chbyv06x` as DYGSM DY-RQ500A (@Koenkk)

# Notes
- Due to #26653 settings configured via environment variables are now written to the `configuration.yaml`
- For Z-Stack users: a new firmware is available for testing [20250321](https://github.com/Koenkk/Z-Stack-firmware/discussions/545)

# Features
- [#26608](https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee2mqtt/issues/26608) Onboarding ([docs](https://www.zigbee2mqtt.io/guide/getting-started/#onboarding)) (@Nerivec)
- [#26742](https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee2mqtt/issues/26742) Support ZigBee on Host adapter (@Nerivec)
- [#26522](https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee2mqtt/issues/26522) Use dynamic import for external JS (@Nerivec)
- [#26805](https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee2mqtt/issues/26805) Frontend: support filtering notifications (@sarthurdev)

# Notes
- This is a hot-fix release to fix issues with the Home Assistant lights discovery (e.g. #26557, https://github.com/zigbee2mqtt/hassio-zigbee2mqtt/issues/736, https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee2mqtt/issues/26562)

# Fixes
- [#26560](https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee2mqtt/issues/26560) Home Assistant: fix brightness only lights (@Koenkk)

# Notes
- This release brings a significant decrease in memory usage. Depending on your setup, you can expect a reduction of 40-60% in [heapUsed](https://aditya003-ay.medium.com/process-memoryusage-in-node-js-03fd6d7074b8) ([#8471](https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee-herdsman-converters/pull/8471)). A big thanks to @Nerivec!

# Notes
- This is a hot-fix release primarily aimed at resolving problems with several Tuya devices not updating (e.g. https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee2mqtt/issues/26168, https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee2mqtt/issues/26124, https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee2mqtt/issues/26180)

# Notes
- For Home Assistant users: this version requires at least Home Assistant 2024.9

# Breaking changes
- [#24200](https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee2mqtt/issues/24200) The big cleanup (@Koenkk)
- [#8291](https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee-herdsman-converters/issues/8291) Remove legacy (@Koenkk)

- [#24947](https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee2mqtt/issues/24947) Cleanup leftover legacy settings logic (@Nerivec)
- [#25286](https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee2mqtt/issues/25286) Change default `homeassistant.status_topic` to `homeassistant/status` (@Koenkk)
- [#24245](https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee2mqtt/issues/24245) HA permit join switch: disable automatically after 254 seconds (@Koenkk)

- [#24257](https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee2mqtt/issues/24257) Improve permit join (@Nerivec)
- [#25082](https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee2mqtt/issues/25082) Remove `permit_join_timeout` (@Koenkk)
- [#24338](https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee2mqtt/issues/24338) Remove configuring group members through `configuration.yaml` (@Koenkk)
- [#24494](https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee2mqtt/issues/24494) Remove deprecated Home Assistant integration features (@Koenkk)

- [#8219](https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee-herdsman-converters/issues/8219) Cleanup `child_lock` (@Koenkk)
- [#8304](https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee-herdsman-converters/issues/8304) Remove `illuminance_lux` (@Koenkk)
- [#8089](https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee-herdsman-converters/issues/8089) Remove `readAfterWriteTime` (@Koenkk)

- [#8362](https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee-herdsman-converters/issues/8362) Busch-Jaeger 6735/6736/6737: Drop deprecated switch state (@klada)
- [#8380](https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee-herdsman-converters/issues/8380) Busch-Jaeger 6735/6736/6737: Don't expose legacy payload anymore (@klada)

# Upcoming Zigbee2MQTT 2.0.0 release

All the preparations for the 2.0.0 release have now been completed. Note that this release will contain **breaking changes** which can be found [here](https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee2mqtt/discussions/24198). Starting from 2 December, users can start testing Zigbee2MQTT 2.0.0 by switching to the [dev branch](https://www.zigbee2mqtt.io/advanced/more/switch-to-dev-branch.html). If no big blockers are found, 2.0.0 will be released on 3 January 2025.

# Improvements

- [#24233](https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee2mqtt/issues/24233) Add experimental support for Home Assistant `event` entities (@mundschenk-at)
- [#8388](https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee-herdsman-converters/issues/8388) Add SR-ZG9002KR12-Pro expose and add ZG9380A zigbeeModel for SR-ZG9042MP (@niracler)
- [#8382](https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee-herdsman-converters/issues/8382) Expose `test` for W599001 (@los7702)
- [#8379](https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee-herdsman-converters/issues/8379) Add switch type to TS110E_2gang_2 (@mikolajpiecuch)
- [#8350](https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee-herdsman-converters/issues/8350) Support OTA for Tuya TS0201 (@lueis)
- [#8326](https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee-herdsman-converters/issues/8326) Expose switch type for TS110E_1gang_2 (@mikolajpiecuch)
- [#8307](https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee-herdsman-converters/issues/8307) Add Livarno Home (Lidl) HG08131A, HG08131B, HG08131C (@RubenKelevra)
- [#8310](https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee-herdsman-converters/issues/8310) Support OTA for RB 272 T (@ltratt)
- [#8280](https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee-herdsman-converters/issues/8280) Add running state to Saswell TRV (@barthez)
- [#8404](https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee-herdsman-converters/issues/8404) Add inverted modes for POK008 (@zombierzn)

# Notes

- Preparations for Zigbee2MQTT 2.0 are underway. This release emphasizes the removal of deprecated features. For more details, please visit: https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee2mqtt/discussions/24198
- Zigbee2MQTT made it into the [_Top 10 open source and public projects attracting the most first-time contributors in 2024 on GitHub_](https://github.blog/news-insights/octoverse/octoverse-2024/). A big thank you to all our contributors! ❤️

# Improvements

- [#24122](https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee2mqtt/issues/24122) Add `throttle` option for devices (@ivanfmartinez)
- [#24244](https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee2mqtt/issues/24244) Allow serving frontend under subpath (@vladimir-kotikov)

- [#8157](https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee-herdsman-converters/issues/8157) Tuya BAC-003 & BAC-002-ALZB: Add support for current_cooling_setpoint (@robvanoostenrijk)

- [#8099](https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee-herdsman-converters/issues/8099) Support calibration up/down for Tuya `_TZ3000_cet6ch1r` (@jonnysciar)

# Notes
- For TI ZStack users: a new firmware has been released, [20240710](https://github.com/Koenkk/Z-Stack-firmware/releases/tag/Z-Stack_3.x.0_coordinator_20240710). This firmware improves reliability and improves performance. To determine what firmware is compatible with your adapter, see the [docs](https://www.zigbee2mqtt.io/guide/adapters/).
- **Experimental** support for [ZBOSS adapters](https://www.zigbee2mqtt.io/guide/adapters/zboss.html) has been added.
- For external extensions (not converters!): the `emitDeviceRemoved` event has been renamed to `emitEntityRemoved`.

# Notes
- This release introduces the ability to change the Zigbee channel of an existing network when using the `zstack` adapter. Note that this functionality was already available for the `ember` adapter in previous releases. ([docs](https://www.zigbee2mqtt.io/guide/configuration/zigbee-network.html#changing-the-zigbee-channel))

# Improvements
- [#7764](https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee-herdsman-converters/issues/7764) Ubisys H1 open window support (@sjorge)
- [#7733](https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee-herdsman-converters/issues/7733) Make 6735/6736/6737 state poll interval configurable and default to 60 seconds (@Koenkk)
- [#7743](https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee-herdsman-converters/issues/7743) Support `silene` for Tuya PA-44Z (@Koenkk)
- [#7716](https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee-herdsman-converters/issues/7716) Expose deviceRunTime for STARKVIND air purifier (@indrajitr)
- [#1117](https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee-herdsman/issues/1117) Add `serialNumber` to `genBasic` cluster (@turboproc)
- [#1116](https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee-herdsman/issues/1116) Add `pm1Measurement` and `pm10Measurement` clusters, update `pm25Measurement` (@turboproc)
- [#1110](https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee-herdsman/issues/1110) Support channel change for z-stack (@Koenkk)
- [#1096](https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee-herdsman/issues/1096) Inovelli Adding P26 For VZM36 (@InovelliUSA)
- [#1106](https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee-herdsman/issues/1106) Ember: Implement requests concurrency (@Nerivec)
- [#1094](https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee-herdsman/issues/1094) Ember: Support for EmberZNet v8.0.0 (@Nerivec)

# Notes
- For Home Assistant users: this release requires at least Home Assistant 2024.4.
- This release contains various improvements to the logging:
    - Zigbee-herdsman now uses the Zigbee2MQTT logger, meaning that the logging will now be included in the Zigbee2MQTT log files.
    - To increase the overal performance of Zigbee2MQTT, debug logging is not logged to `zigbee2mqtt/bridge/logging` and the frontend anymore.
- The `ezsp` driver is now deprecated in favour of the new `ember` driver. The `ember` driver will become the officially supported driver for EmberZNet adapters in the future. See [this discussion](https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee2mqtt/discussions/21462) for more info and how to migrate.

# Notes
- Due to some internal changes, some external converters will break. To fix it simply remove `const extend = require('zigbee-herdsman-converters/lib/extend');` from the external converter.

# Notes
This release adds support for a new experimental Ember driver which can be used as a replacement for the existing EZSP adapter driver. In case you are currently experiencing issues with your EZSP adapter (e.g. Dongle-E/SkyConnect), please give it a try. Instructions on how to use it can be found [here](https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee2mqtt/discussions/21462). Many thanks to @Nerivec for implementing this!

First of all, happy new year! 🎆

This release contains a quite fundamental change on how Zigbee2MQTT handles unsupported devices.
Zigbee2MQTT will now attempt to automatically detect features supported by the device and discover those to e.g. the frontend and Home Assistant.
This means that if you, for example pair an unsupported light, there is no need to wait for official support. Basic features will work out-of-the-box.
The way to officially add support for devices has also been simplified due to this ([docs](https://www.zigbee2mqtt.io/advanced/support-new-devices/01_support_new_devices.html#_2-creating-the-external-definition)). These changes have been made in [#6692](https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee-herdsman-converters/issues/6692) and [#20358](https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee2mqtt/pull/20358).

- [#19994](https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee2mqtt/pull/19994) Support bridge discovery for Home Assistant (@mundschenk-at)

releases.name: 2025.9.0b0
releases.body:
Beta release notes can be found here: https://rc.home-assistant.io/latest-release-notes

Please note that these release notes are a work in progress. 👷‍♀️ We will be completing them over the next couple of days. Not all features might be final yet, and some features _**may not** make it into the final release_.

---

**Want to help test the beta?** Awesome! ❤️ We have documented how you [can join our beta channel and install the beta here](https://www.home-assistant.io/common-tasks/os/#running-a-beta-version).

While running the beta, we highly recommend joining our _#beta_ channel on the [Home Assistant Discord chat](https://www.home-assistant.io/join-chat)! 💬 Most developers and beta testers are in this channel during the beta period to share experiences, ideas, and iterate over new features, fine-tuning them before the final release. It's a really fun place to hang out. 😎

**Reporting issues**: As this is a beta test, you might encounter unexpected behavior or issues. 🐞 We use the GitHub issue tracker to track beta issues. You can find our issue trackers and the reported issues during beta here:

- [Report(ed) beta **dashboards/UI/frontend** issues](https://github.com/home-assistant/frontend/milestone/135)
- [Report(ed) beta **integrations/automations/backend/core** issues](https://github.com/home-assistant/core/milestone/760)
- [Report(ed) beta **documentation** issues](https://github.com/home-assistant/home-assistant.io/milestone/142)

🙏 When reporting issues, **make sure to mention the exact beta version you are running** in the issue description. This will help us identify and track the issue correctly. Read more about [reporting issues here](https://www.home-assistant.io/help/reporting_issues/).

- Add pymodbus to package constraints ([@epenet] - [#150420])
- Fix enphase_envoy non existing via device warning at first config. ([@catsmanac] - [#149010]) ([enphase_envoy docs])
- Handle non-streaming TTS case correctly ([@synesthesiam] - [#150218]) ([tts docs]) ([wyoming docs])
- Pi_hole - Account for auth succeeding when it shouldn't ([@HarvsG] - [#150413]) ([pi_hole docs])
- Bump habiticalib to version 0.4.2 ([@tr4nt0r] - [#150417]) ([habitica docs]) (dependency)
- Fix optimistic set to false for template entities ([@Petro31] - [#150421]) ([template docs])
- Fix error of the Powerfox integration in combination with the new Powerfox FLOW adapter ([@DavidCraftDev] - [#150429]) ([powerfox docs])
- Bump python-snoo to 0.7.0 ([@kevin-david] - [#150434]) ([snoo docs]) (dependency)
- Fix brightness command not sent when in white color mode ([@wedsa5] - [#150439]) ([tuya docs])
- Bump cookidoo-api to 0.14.0 ([@miaucl] - [#150450]) ([cookidoo docs]) (dependency)
- Fix YoLink valve state when device running in class A mode ([@matrixd2] - [#150456]) ([yolink docs])
- Additional Fix error on startup when no Apps or Radio plugins are installed for Squeezebox ([@peteS-UK] - [#150475]) ([squeezebox docs])
- Fix re-auth flow for Volvo integration ([@thomasddn] - [#150478]) ([volvo docs])
- Improve Z-Wave manual config flow step description ([@MartinHjelmare] - [#150479]) ([zwave_js docs])
- Add missing boost2 code for Miele hobs ([@astrandb] - [#150481]) ([miele docs])
- Bump airOS to 0.2.8 ([@CoMPaTech] - [#150504]) ([airos docs]) (dependency)
- Bump aiowebostv to 0.7.5 ([@thecode] - [#150514]) ([webostv docs]) (dependency)
- Bump bleak-retry-connector to 4.0.1 ([@bdraco] - [#150515]) ([bluetooth docs]) (dependency)
- Bump aiodhcpwatcher to 1.2.1 ([@bdraco] - [#150519]) ([dhcp docs]) (dependency)
- Bump python-snoo to 0.8.1 ([@Lash-L] - [#150530]) ([snoo docs]) (dependency)
- Bump uv to 0.8.9 ([@edenhaus] - [#150542]) (dependency)
- Bump python-snoo to 0.8.2 ([@Lash-L] - [#150569]) ([snoo docs]) (dependency)
- Change Snoo to use MQTT instead of PubNub ([@Lash-L] - [#150570]) ([snoo docs])
- Make sure we update the api version in philips_js discovery ([@elupus] - [#150604]) ([philips_js docs])
- Bump pymiele to 0.5.3 ([@astrandb] - [#150216]) ([miele docs]) (dependency)
- Bump pymiele to 0.5.4 ([@astrandb] - [#150605]) ([miele docs]) (dependency)
- Bump airOS to 0.2.11 ([@CoMPaTech] - [#150627]) ([airos docs]) (dependency)
- Bump uiprotect to 7.21.1 ([@bdraco] - [#150657]) ([unifiprotect docs]) (dependency)
- Bump onvif-zeep-async to 4.0.3 ([@bdraco] - [#150663]) ([onvif docs]) (dependency)
- Bump python-snoo to 0.8.3 ([@Lash-L] - [#150670]) ([snoo docs]) (dependency)
- Fix missing labels for subdiv in workday ([@gjohansson-ST] - [#150684]) ([workday docs])
- Improve handling decode errors in rest ([@gjohansson-ST] - [#150699]) ([rest docs])

- Make Tuya complex type handling explicit ([@epenet] - [#149677]) ([tuya docs])
- Fix Enigma2 startup hang ([@BlackBadPinguin] - [#149756]) ([enigma2 docs])
- Fix dialog enhancement switch for Sonos Arc Ultra ([@PeteRager] - [#150116]) ([sonos docs])
- Bump ZHA to 0.0.67 ([@puddly] - [#150132]) ([zha docs]) (dependency)
- Bump airOS to 0.2.6 improving device class matching more devices ([@CoMPaTech] - [#150134]) ([airos docs]) (dependency)
- Handle HusqvarnaWSClientError ([@Thomas55555] - [#150145]) ([husqvarna_automower docs])
- Fix Progettihwsw config flow ([@gaspa85] - [#150149]) ([progettihwsw docs])
- Bump imgw_pib to version 1.5.3 ([@bieniu] - [#150178]) ([imgw_pib docs]) (dependency)
- Fix description of `button.press` action ([@NoRi2909] - [#150181]) ([button docs])
- Migrate unique_id only if monitor_id is present in Uptime Kuma ([@tr4nt0r] - [#150197]) ([uptime_kuma docs])
- Silence vacuum battery deprecation for built in integrations ([@MartinHjelmare] - [#150204]) ([vacuum docs])
- Bump ZHA to 0.0.68 ([@puddly] - [#150208]) ([zha docs]) (dependency)
- Bump hass-nabucasa from 0.111.1 to 0.111.2 ([@ludeeus] - [#150209]) ([cloud docs]) (dependency)
- Fix JSON serialization for ZHA diagnostics download ([@puddly] - [#150210]) ([zha docs])
- Ignore MQTT vacuum battery warning ([@MartinHjelmare] - [#150211]) ([mqtt docs]) ([vacuum docs])
- Handle Unifi Protect BadRequest exception during API key creation ([@RaHehl] - [#150223]) ([unifiprotect docs])
- Fix Tibber coordinator ContextVar warning ([@MartinHjelmare] - [#150229]) ([tibber docs])
- Fix handing for zero volume error in Squeezebox ([@peteS-UK] - [#150265]) ([squeezebox docs])
- Fix error on startup when no Apps or Radio plugins are installed for Squeezebox ([@peteS-UK] - [#150267]) ([squeezebox docs])
- Volvo: fix missing charging power options ([@thomasddn] - [#150272]) ([volvo docs])
- Constraint num2words to 0.5.14 ([@edenhaus] - [#150276])
- Volvo: fix distance to empty battery ([@thomasddn] - [#150278]) ([volvo docs])
- Add GPT-5 support ([@Shulyaka] - [#150281]) ([openai_conversation docs])
- Volvo: Skip unsupported API fields ([@thomasddn] - [#150285]) ([volvo docs])
- Remove misleading "the" from Launch Library configuration ([@NoRi2909] - [#150288]) ([launch_library docs])
- Set suggested display precision on Volvo energy/fuel consumption sensors ([@steinmn] - [#150296]) ([volvo docs])
- Bump airOS to 0.2.7 supporting firmware 8.7.11 ([@CoMPaTech] - [#150298]) ([airos docs]) (dependency)
- Update knx-frontend to 2025.8.9.63154 ([@philippwaller] - [#150323]) ([knx docs]) (dependency)
- Update frontend to 20250811.0 ([@bramkragten] - [#150404]) ([frontend docs]) (dependency)
- Handle empty electricity RAW sensors in Tuya ([@epenet] - [#150406]) ([tuya docs])
- Lower Z-Wave firmware check delay ([@MartinHjelmare] - [#150411]) ([zwave_js docs])
- Fix issue with Tuya suggested unit ([@epenet] - [#150414]) ([tuya docs])

releases.name: 2025.8.0b5
releases.body:
- Fix zero-argument functions with as_function (@depoll - #150062)
- Fix update coordinator ContextVar log for custom integrations (@MartinHjelmare - #150100)

releases.name: 2025.8.0b0
releases.body:
Beta release notes can be found here: https://rc.home-assistant.io/latest-release-notes

Please note that these release notes are a work in progress. 👷‍♀️ We will be completing them over the next couple of days. Not all features might be final yet, and some features _**may not** make it into the final release_.

---

**Want to help test the beta?** Awesome! ❤️ We have documented how you [can join our beta channel and install the beta here](https://www.home-assistant.io/common-tasks/os/#running-a-beta-version).

While running the beta, we highly recommend joining our _#beta_ channel on the [Home Assistant Discord chat](https://www.home-assistant.io/join-chat)! 💬 Most developers and beta testers are in this channel during the beta period to share experiences, ideas, and iterate over new features, fine-tuning them before the final release. It's a really fun place to hang out. 😎

**Reporting issues**: As this is a beta test, you might encounter unexpected behavior or issues. 🐞 We use the GitHub issue tracker to track beta issues. You can find our issue trackers and the reported issues during beta here:

- [Report(ed) beta **dashboards/UI/frontend** issues](https://github.com/home-assistant/frontend/milestone/134)
- [Report(ed) beta **integrations/automations/backend/core** issues](https://github.com/home-assistant/core/milestone/751)
- [Report(ed) beta **documentation** issues](https://github.com/home-assistant/home-assistant.io/milestone/141)

🙏 When reporting issues, **make sure to mention the exact beta version you are running** in the issue description. This will help us identify and track the issue correctly. Read more about [reporting issues here](https://www.home-assistant.io/help/reporting_issues/).

releases.name: v2.31.1-beta
releases.body:
# Contributors: The following users have been contributing to this release. Thank you for that!
@BEskandari, @Sekenfo, @Smanar, @github-actions[bot], @justin-caldicott, @manup and @mattreim
# Changes ## Device Support - DDF add support for the PO-BOCO-ELEC (pilot wire heater) from Powernity [#8314](https://github.com/dresden-elektronik/deconz-rest-plugin/pull/8314) - DDF for Tuya Temperature Humidity Moisture Sensor (_TZE200_npj9bug3) [#8311](https://github.com/dresden-elektronik/deconz-rest-plugin/pull/8311) - DDF for Tuya 3 gangs locked device [#8309](https://github.com/dresden-elektronik/deconz-rest-plugin/pull/8309) - DDF for Sonoff SNZB-02LD/eWeLink CK-TLSR8656-SS5-01(7014) and correction [#8300](https://github.com/dresden-elektronik/deconz-rest-plugin/pull/8300) - DDF clone for Innr SP 242 plug [#8302](https://github.com/dresden-elektronik/deconz-rest-plugin/pull/8302) - DDF for Tuya Motion Sensor TS0601 (_TZE200_bh3n6gk8/_TZE200_1ibpyhdc) [#8305](https://github.com/dresden-elektronik/deconz-rest-plugin/pull/8305) - DDF clone for Tuya 4 gang switch (_TZ3000_zgyzgdua) [#8307](https://github.com/dresden-elektronik/deconz-rest-plugin/pull/8307) ## Bugfixes - Fix Phoscon App login page causing 401 HTTP errors with Home Assistant Ingress [deconz-lib/#3](https://github.com/dresden-elektronik/deconz-lib/issues/3)

releases.name: v2.31.0-beta
releases.body:
# Contributors: The following users have been contributing to this release. Thank you for that!
@BEskandari, @Cadkey, @Doskii, @Maik1, @Martinvdm, @SilverFire, @Smanar, @cs42, @ebaauw, @github-actions[bot], @gjasny, @joctee, @kuzmin-no, @manup, @mariomaz87, @mattreim and @minhtuannguyen
# Changes ## Visual changes and dark mode theme The refactoring of the GUI is ongoing to split into separate core and GUI applications (see [deconz/development](https://github.com/dresden-elektronik/deconz?tab=readme-ov-file#development) for details). This version brings a new dedicated dark mode theme which also shows more live details on devices: ### On/off state for lights and plugs If a device is turned on it is shown with a yellow frame around it. In the screenshot "Osram GU10" light is off and "Spot 4" light is on. ### Sensor state and values Sensor nodes now show a view state properties — currently temperature, light level as lux, presence, vibration, alarms like water, fire, etc. The new purple dot indicator represents binary states like presence or vibration. It is lit when active. In the screenshot the motion sensor "Presence 354"is currently active and sensing motion, the "Vibration 359" sensor is currently not triggered. ### How to enable dark mode By default the known classic theme is active. The new theme can be enabled in *Menu > View > Dark theme*. Upcoming versions will also bring light themes using the new style. ### Data view Via *Menu > Help > Data view* all data from devices from the REST API plugin is now visible and updated in real time. This is currently only a view for developers and the underlying model is the base to split up core and GUI. In future this view will gain search / filter fields for easier navigation. ## Qt6 support The code has been refactored to support Qt5 and Qt6, since Qt5 won't gain much features needed for modern desktops like Linux Wayland or HighDPI support in Windows and macOS. The first deCONZ version using this is the `deCONZ_Setup_Win64_V2_31_00.exe` package which is build with Qt6 and for 64-bit. The `deCONZ_Setup_Win32_V2_31_00.exe` contains the usual Qt5 and 32-bit build. macOS versions will also be updated for Qt6 in future. For Linux we need to figure out a good approach to support old and new distributions. ## Device Support - DDF for Namron Zigbee Stove Guard 140279X [#8289](https://github.com/dresden-elektronik/deconz-rest-plugin/pull/8289) - DDF add primary support for the Aqara Door Window Sensor P1 [#8284](https://github.com/dresden-elektronik/deconz-rest-plugin/pull/8284) - DDF for Sonoff smart Plug (S60ZBTPF) [#8286](https://github.com/dresden-elektronik/deconz-rest-plugin/pull/8286) - DDF clone for Tuya Zigbee Smart Rain Sensor (_TZ3000_amis43tj) [#8285](https://github.com/dresden-elektronik/deconz-rest-plugin/pull/8285) - DDF for Philips Hue smart plug LOM006 [#8281](https://github.com/dresden-elektronik/deconz-rest-plugin/pull/8281) - Fix for new IKEA RODRET model identifier [#8279](https://github.com/dresden-elektronik/deconz-rest-plugin/pull/8279) - DDF for Tuya light sensor (_TZ3000_9kbbfeho) [#8277](https://github.com/dresden-elektronik/deconz-rest-plugin/pull/8277) - DDF for Mumubiz switch with temperature / humidity sensor TYZGTH1CH-D1RF (_TZ3218_7fiyo3kv) [#8272](https://github.com/dresden-elektronik/deconz-rest-plugin/pull/8272) - DDF for Third Reality Motion Sensor R1 (3RSMR01067Z) [#8276](https://github.com/dresden-elektronik/deconz-rest-plugin/pull/8276) - DDF for Tuya TS0046 6-gang switch [#8270](https://github.com/dresden-elektronik/deconz-rest-plugin/pull/8270) - DDF clone for SONOFF SNZB-02LD variant [#8268](https://github.com/dresden-elektronik/deconz-rest-plugin/pull/8268) - Update xiaomi_ssm-u01_t1_switch.json [#8263](https://github.com/dresden-elektronik/deconz-rest-plugin/pull/8263) - DDF for Tuya presence sensor (_TZ3000_bb6xaihh with model id SNZB-03) [#8267](https://github.com/dresden-elektronik/deconz-rest-plugin/pull/8267) - DDF clone for Scimagic Soil Moisture Sensor (_TZE284_oitavov2) [#8261](https://github.com/dresden-elektronik/deconz-rest-plugin/pull/8261) - DDF clone for Tuya 4 Gang remote (_TZ3000_5tqxpine) [#8249](https://github.com/dresden-elektronik/deconz-rest-plugin/pull/8249) - DDF clones for Tuya Air sensors [#8244](https://github.com/dresden-elektronik/deconz-rest-plugin/pull/8244) - DDF clone for Tuya covering Yoolex (_TZE200_9caxna4s) [#8237](https://github.com/dresden-elektronik/deconz-rest-plugin/pull/8237) - DDF for Namron 8 button switch (4512772, 4512773) [#8240](https://github.com/dresden-elektronik/deconz-rest-plugin/pull/8240) - DDF clone for newer variant of Heiman HS1SA-E [#8242](https://github.com/dresden-elektronik/deconz-rest-plugin/pull/8242) - DDF Tuya 2-gangs switch poll battery status [#8243](https://github.com/dresden-elektronik/deconz-rest-plugin/pull/8243) - DDF for Aqara E1 single rocker wireless switch WXKG16LM [#8245](https://github.com/dresden-elektronik/deconz-rest-plugin/pull/8245) - DDF for MultIR smoke sensor MIR-SM100-E [#8248](https://github.com/dresden-elektronik/deconz-rest-plugin/pull/8248) - DDF use dm3 insteaof of m3 for state/flow [#8250](https://github.com/dresden-elektronik/deconz-rest-plugin/pull/8250) - DDF clone for Sunricher SR-ZG9080A with enhancements [#8252](https://github.com/dresden-elektronik/deconz-rest-plugin/pull/8252) - DDF clone for Tuya temperature/humidity sensor (_TZE284_wtikaxzs) [#8235](https://github.com/dresden-elektronik/deconz-rest-plugin/pull/8235) - DDF clone for Tuya smoke detector (_TZE284_rccxox8p) [#8231](https://github.com/dresden-elektronik/deconz-rest-plugin/pull/8231) ## Enhancements - Support build with Qt6 (alpha) [#8295](https://github.com/dresden-elektronik/deconz-rest-plugin/pull/8295) - Add actor model to query device resources and resource items as VFS [#8274](https://github.com/dresden-elektronik/deconz-rest-plugin/pull/8274) - Update xiaomi_ssm-u01_t1_switch.json [#8263](https://github.com/dresden-elektronik/deconz-rest-plugin/pull/8263) - Deprecate product_match.cpp [#8264](https://github.com/dresden-elektronik/deconz-rest-plugin/pull/8264) - Update general.xml file to use more data from LiXee device [#8228](https://github.com/dresden-elektronik/deconz-rest-plugin/pull/8228) - Enable status reporting for Parkside Smart Watering Timer (_TZE200_htnnfasr) [#8226](https://github.com/dresden-elektronik/deconz-rest-plugin/pull/8226) ## Bug Fixes - Fix state/reachable and config/reachable not stored in database [#8297](https://github.com/dresden-elektronik/deconz-rest-plugin/pull/8297) - Fix QVariant can't be assigned to const char* in Qt6 [#8294](https://github.com/dresden-elektronik/deconz-rest-plugin/pull/8294) - Fix QDateTime::toTime_t() missing in Qt6 [#8293](https://github.com/dresden-elektronik/deconz-rest-plugin/pull/8293) - Fix QString::midRef() missing in Qt6 [#8292](https://github.com/dresden-elektronik/deconz-rest-plugin/pull/8292) - Fix QTextCodec missing in Qt6 [#8291](https://github.com/dresden-elektronik/deconz-rest-plugin/pull/8291) - Include header for Qt6 compatibility [#8290](https://github.com/dresden-elektronik/deconz-rest-plugin/pull/8290) - Fix creation of invalid Unicast Bindings [#8288](https://github.com/dresden-elektronik/deconz-rest-plugin/pull/8288) - Fix Xiaomi TH-S02D sensor pressure value calculation [#8275](https://github.com/dresden-elektronik/deconz-rest-plugin/pull/8275) - Fix battery reading of Sonoff water valve SWV-BSP [#8254](https://github.com/dresden-elektronik/deconz-rest-plugin/pull/8254) - DDF rollback for PR Tuya 2-gangs switch poll battery status [#8255](https://github.com/dresden-elektronik/deconz-rest-plugin/pull/8255) - Remove a duplicate line in general.xml [#8227](https://github.com/dresden-elektronik/deconz-rest-plugin/pull/8227) - Fix /devices endpoint not having UTC timestamps for "value" [#8230](https://github.com/dresden-elektronik/deconz-rest-plugin/pull/8230)

releases.name: v2.30.2

# Changes

This stable version contains the changes and important bug fixes.
Please refer to the changelogs of beta for more details:

[v2.30.1-beta](https://github.com/dresden-elektronik/deconz-rest-plugin/releases/tag/v2.30.1-beta)

releases.name: v2.30.1-beta
releases.body:
# Contributors: The following users have been contributing to this release. Thank you for that!
@Smanar, @SwoopX, @manup, @mattreim and @tobyDoh
# Changes While v2.30.1 was planned as stable release we encountered quite some bugs in the REST API which needed to be addressed first to make it easier for REST API clients. Therefore this is one more beta before going stable. ## Device Support - DDF clone for Tuya door/window sensor (_TZ3000_bpkijo14) [#8196](https://github.com/dresden-elektronik/deconz-rest-plugin/pull/8196) - DDF clone for Tuya door/window sensor (_TZE200_n8dljorx) [#8209](https://github.com/dresden-elektronik/deconz-rest-plugin/pull/8209) - DDF for Ubisys Router R0 [#8203](https://github.com/dresden-elektronik/deconz-rest-plugin/pull/8203) - DDF for Shelly 1PM mini gen4 [#8201](https://github.com/dresden-elektronik/deconz-rest-plugin/pull/8201) - DDF for Shelly 1PM gen4 [#8205](https://github.com/dresden-elektronik/deconz-rest-plugin/pull/8205) - DDF for Shelly 1 gen4 [#8207](https://github.com/dresden-elektronik/deconz-rest-plugin/pull/8207) ## Enhancements - Expose NWK address as hex value through REST API [#8199](https://github.com/dresden-elektronik/deconz-rest-plugin/pull/8199) - Improve ZGP device representation [#8218](https://github.com/dresden-elektronik/deconz-rest-plugin/pull/8218) - Make Device creation time available [#8214](https://github.com/dresden-elektronik/deconz-rest-plugin/pull/8214) ## Bug Fixes - Fix strings without data being null, return empty string instead [#8223](https://github.com/dresden-elektronik/deconz-rest-plugin/pull/8223) - Fix don't expose null values from Device for sensors and lights [#8222](https://github.com/dresden-elektronik/deconz-rest-plugin/pull/8222) - Fix missing lights and groups Websocket deleted events [#8221](https://github.com/dresden-elektronik/deconz-rest-plugin/pull/8221) - Fix don't expose Configuration tool (coordinator) lastannounced [#8220](https://github.com/dresden-elektronik/deconz-rest-plugin/pull/8220) - Fix legacy sensors lastseen or lastannounced = null [#8219](https://github.com/dresden-elektronik/deconz-rest-plugin/pull/8219) - Fix don't expose `ddf_hash` and `ddf_policy` for lights and sensors [#8217](https://github.com/dresden-elektronik/deconz-rest-plugin/pull/8217) - Fix don't expose internal attr/zonetype to REST-API [#8216](https://github.com/dresden-elektronik/deconz-rest-plugin/pull/8216) - Fix attr/lastannounced and attr/lastseen sometimes being null [#8215](https://github.com/dresden-elektronik/deconz-rest-plugin/pull/8215) - Fix ResourceItem set (UTC) timestamps from string [#8213](https://github.com/dresden-elektronik/deconz-rest-plugin/pull/8213) - Ensure lights and sensors always have valid Etag [#8202](https://github.com/dresden-elektronik/deconz-rest-plugin/pull/8202)
